ZNDprH8MRFSMLRifvbt0AA.text: They always give great service and Their Fried Saba and Bi Bim Bop is so Ono!!  Uncle Russell always hooks it up!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Island Style!!!

6kWYYpULDMkr1HxiD31FrA.text: I love this place.... One of the True tasting Hawaiian Japanese food places i town. The service is always great. And i never had to complain about anything. EVER. Please if you're next to here stop in. They have all you need.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZVLlfXBcloZefshLlj8k3g.text: I made the mistake of coming here before looking up the Yelp reviews, and somehow expected Hawaiian food rather than (mostly) Korean and (some) Chinese with island influence. The bare-bones dining room was also a bit surprising to me, but the food is solid.  COMBO PLATE: This three-meat treat will set you back about $16 but is easily enough food for two. The kalbi was my favorite, while BF preferred the meat jun. Sides of mac salad and rice are plentiful, and you also get the banchan (mostly spicy/pickled items this visit). MANDU: Pot stickers, available in half (4 piece) and full (8 piece) orders, either pan-fried, deep-fried, or steamed. The fried versions were soggy but the dipping sauce is tasty. SPAM MUSUBI: I love this dish, but not here. Entirely too much rice, and such minimal sauce as to render it nonexistent. It's sad when L&L makes a better version.  Service was attentive and pleasant. Menu has a lot of options, but you can easily get a filling meal under $10/pp here. All the Korean customers around us were only eating jja jjang myun (black bean noodles) so maybe that's the best dish to get here. I'll have to try next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banchan
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spam Musubi
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OYyrSNVqIlPrlYXuZ-afgg.text: Good food. Good prices. Great service. Authentic food. Only had Korean dishes while there.

Ju1y8nQpZbJuPn-sTmxkZg.text: Now This is authentic local style the food . taste is great, workers are very friendly,  the place is clean.  it's just a little hole in the wall that unless you yelp this you will probably not find it. This place is mixed with local people with the flavor on the side of Korean.  Also the food came quickly. Plus they give orderves, we got boil peanuts, kim chee, cucumber-chee, long rice & vienna sausage. They give a lot, you probably most chance won't finish it. 5 stars no question in my mind. You wont be disappointed.

tZXKGOb4xbOVMmep3hISaA.text: Best jajamang place. This a a family owned restaurant and my family has been coming here for years and years. Still by far my favorite Chinese-Korean dishes. I don't eat the Hawaiian dishes, so couldn't tell you if it is good.

3vrh9Zs7FyS4V2nlrGzOBw.text: Stuck in Vegas for a month because of work, so I decided to be as local as possible and try out all the gems outside of the strip.    I try to not to eat out as much to stay healthy, so my options are limited, decided to get Korean food and found Island style on yelp.  This place is located at the middle of a line of shopping stores, it will take an extra second to find it but not hard following the gps.  Also since it is in Vegas, all the windows got black screens to block the Sun, so you wouldn't be able to look inside, I had to double checked the sign few times before I walked in.    It is a little warm inside but it is in the middle of the summer in Vegas.  The waitress gave me 2 menus and when she found out that I was eating by myself she was surprised and started to talk to me.  I told her I visited Korea a while back and how much I loved Korea, she told me to find a Korean girlfriend and move to Korea. Very friendly and funny, then I decided to get the cold noodle soup.  The soup was really good, almost as good as the one I had in Korea.  Since I been back to the States I tried few the same dish in different locations in California but they were a bit disappointing.    I really want to try the black beans noodle but I will give that a try next time.  Actually there are many items on the menu that I want to try.  Great food with friendly staff, I will come back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cold noodles.
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very hard working lady.
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very friendly staff, also very funny in a good way.

sxtN0WxutZALfj6LsUtWiw.text: Visited several times and never disappointed. The bi bim bop is delicious and served really hot (be careful). This place is a hidden jewel.

IbP98MT574FeGoBEkRqDjg.text: Good spot for Vegas locals. Not in the most appealing area, but the service and the food make up for it. It will be a little on the high end for some people, but the servings are huge. I usually order jajamyen (or however that's spelled), meat jun, kalbi ribs. The owner is very friendly, and very hospitable.

ZaOjP6tJUko0K0O56Fte8w.text: IT'S OFFICIAL. This restaurant does NOT live up to its name and the high rating of 4.5. You got to be kidding me.  There is NOTHING special about this place. Food is whatever. Service is nonexistent. Ambiance is bad. Interior/Exterior is crappy as hell.  I got my Black Bean Noodle with the sauce on the side. It was probably the worst Gan Jjajangmyun I've had in my life. It was very dry and the sauce was so thick like it looked really unappetizing as if someone actually puked. I am talking about the texture of the sauce and the noodle combination. Horrible. I ended up not eating.   What's worst? Our bill was $21.51 and I had put $25.51. Never got my change back. Were they really expecting that I am going to tip them $4 for the service that wasnt even offered? I got so pissed on top of my food end up tasting like shit. I went up to the register and asked for my change. They already closed my check and had put $4 in the tip jar or the register. HOW RIDICULOUS IS THIS?  I am seriously not coming back here ever again. I didnt even want to come here in the first place today and I was so right on that.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Jjambbong - Bleh
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nasty Gan Jjajang - Dont order this. I warned you.

RMJWBF5GXvPhzduzVtCHCQ.text: First time here and wasn't disappointed. Went here because my gf couldn't find meat jun in Orange County, CA where we're from. We got the combo plate which came with rice, BBQ chicken, short ribs, and meat jun. They also give you some Korean side dishes. The portions were large and the food was delicious. It was my first time trying meat jun and glad this place delivered a great first experience. This place has been added as a must have when I visit Las Vegas.

Uj1A8hmXmN-YRSboddGLCQ.text: Annyeonghaseyo!  Cheat day approved. We always feel hustled at all of the high-price-point Korean restaurants in town. Out of all of the ones we have tried since moving to Las Vegas, Island Style did not let us down. You seriously get a ton of food for your buck and the food actually tastes good. If you are looking for a small portion, or tiny bite, this is not the place to go.   You will not even believe the portion sizes here. HUGE. Even the banchan (Korean side dishes) were a generous, heaping serving. My boyfriend and I came here with our massive appetites and we were totally defeated. We ended taking home over 60% of the food. That's nuts, even for us. We decided that when we return, we will only need to order one combo plate and share it.  We really enjoyed the authentic Korean banchan selection. The salt boiled peanuts were shockingly delicious. I'm really obsessed with munching on those tasty little guys. Everything else was seasoned and pickled just right; tangy, slightly sweet, and not obnoxiously spicy. They offered - kkakdugi (pickled daikon radish), kongnamul-muchim (bean sporuts), kimchi (pickled cabbage), cold seaweed, and also my absolute favorite was the addictive cheonsachae with mayo (white crunchy kelp noodles). Flavor rating: 5//5  My boyfriend ordered the meat combo plate that was about $12 - Its a crazy amount of food! It comes with 1 Kalbi rib, 1 meat jun, 1 thin breast of BBQ chicken and a big scoop of macaroni salad. We also substituted the white rice for spam fried rice. My favorites were the meat jun and the spam fried rice! We never had meat jun before, but it was so delicious! It's a seasoned hamburger patty covered in a tasty egg batter. The fried rice also had a bunch of spam. The kalbi had great charred and grilled flavor, but 1 rib didn't offer up enough meat; more of a tease. Also the grilled chicken was a tad bland. Flavor rating: 4/5  I really wanted something warm and comforting: a hot and spicy soup would hit the spot. I had my mind on ordering the Soondubu (hot and spicy tofu soup) but I later discovered that they only carry a seafood version, which I was not feeling at the moment. Our waiter was kind and recommended that I try the Yukgaejang (spicy beef and vegetable noodle soup.) I appreciated his tip, so I went for it. It came out steamy hot, the broth hit the spot. It was slightly spicy and very comforting, yet, it wasn't proportional; I wish there was more noodles, after 3 bites I was left with all veggies, some dry meat and a ton of broth. In the future I would definitely  request for extra, extra noodles. Flavor rating: 3/5  The SKIP list:   * Spam musubi - The spam was sliced paper thin and there was way too much packed, dense rice. I ended up peeling off over half of the rice. Also, the dark, savory and sweet sauce to enhance the musubi was missing. Flavor rating:1/5  * Pan fried mandu, it came out soggy and the filling was exceptionally bland. Unfortunately, the dipping sauce didn't do much to enhance it. Flavor rating: 2/5  ~Gamsahabnida!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. exceptionally bland Pan fried mandu. SKIP
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spam musubi super dense with rice, not enough spam. SKIP
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination plate with kalbi, meat jun, bbq chicken &amp; spam fried rice &amp; Mac salad. Yummy! So much food!

uQt9a6EGm8GK55h9r70kRA.text: You know... people need to realize if they want 5 star quality then goto MGM and get it. I have very koreanized parents and its just culture how they do business. I have never felt neglected as a customer and i love the food here! I do understand that it gets PACKED here and it does get busy. Its better than being neglected when the place is slow! I love it. I love the flavors and i love the kind servers! I come atleast 3 times a month if not 6 lol.

FOmwPUk2MwE8y5dE3UAcnw.text: Great experience! Great Service! If you can't decide what you want to eat, come and eat here! You will certainly find your craving satisfied! Portion size and value was incomparable to most restaurants. They actually pack your food here for you...amazing! We're definitely coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Hawaiian Combo
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bimbibap with pork belly!

8ig97Yeqp6scajSSrZVzIg.text: I guess I should have taken a picture of the delicious kimchi fried rice I ordered. Seriously... the best kimchi fried rice I've ever had!!!   Staff was friendly and even offered me water when I came to pick up my order.   Parking was a little tight---maybe  because people were in a rush to come here and eat. LOL.

H2jrSzxPFaUtOCZ2xHETFw.text: Talk about a hidden mini mall gem...  I always have to concentrate every time I come here since all of the mini malls look the same on this side of town.  The menu is a happy eclectic mix of Korean, Hawaiian Korean and most recently Chinese. I personally have never ventured to the Chinese part of the menu so you are on your own with that. I come here for the Hawaiian-Korean food and nothing else!   First off they hook you up with a tray of boiled peanuts as soon as you sit down. I'd come here just for the boiled peanuts during football season.  They also provide you with 3-4 plate of ban chan that also have a Hawaii flavor to them as well. One of the non-traditional ban chan that is one of my favorites is the chopped hot dog and onions. I remember eating this all the time when I was a kid.. It  strikes a chord with 8 year old Pat. The rest of the ban chan is your typical Korean fare consisting of kim chee variations and other pickled goodies.   My default order: Pan fried mandoo a custom mixed plate:  Kalbi, Meat Jun and Chicken Katsu . The rock star of the combo is the Mean Jun! Great meat to egg ratio and killer sauce! I can say that their Meat Jun is my favorite in the valley! On occasion the lady gets the Jajangmyeon (hope that's the right spelling) which is    This place has become our default Hawaiian-Korean spot.  Go see Uncle Russell and fam to satisfy your K-808 cravings  Aloha   -P

gcnJBW_BDq2fn6Fk1KQagw.text: Wowwww!! Just went there for lunch today and it's legit!! Loco moco and meat jun was good!!! They use good meat for the meat jun too, it's not tough or chewy like some places. The hamburger for the loco moco was tasty too! They also have the good kine kim chee. It's hard to find good local hawaii food that actually taste like it does back home. But they def kept the hawaii taste and service. My new fav spot

Noc8HE091D3dYVodDDOckQ.text: Hubby and I stopped in here for a "snack" and were surprised to see that it resembled more of a home-style Korean restaurant than an "island" (read: Hawaiian) joint.  It was late, maybe 1:30 and they weren't busy at all on a Saturday.  We were quickly seated and given menus along with iced barley tea and boiled peanuts.  We eagerly fell on the peanuts while perusing their menu.  So............I hate to do this to a joint that's so highly rated and with such friendly people but..............  My food came after an appropriate wait, not too long but not particularly quickly either, oxtail soup and spam musubi.  Hubby graciously persuaded me to start eating so I dug in while he snacked on the ban chan and peanuts and tasted my food.  No mac salad, no cold noodles.  After another while longer, we noted two, three other tables seated well after us getting all their food and chowing down together.  We gave it a few more minutes because maybe different kitchen zones were less busy than others.  Finally, we had to flag someone down.  The guy said he would go check on our order.  This part is what peeves me:  I know the temptation to cover up is great.  But I really don't like it when people don't come clean.  Apologize and tell me you forgot the order and I'll most likely forgive you because you were honest.   But don't tell me "Your order will be out shortly, it just takes a little while."  A few minutes later, I see through the window, the cook transferring dark noodles from point A to point B.  They plain forgot about the cold noodles AND the mac salad!  They didn't even acknowledge the mac salad after we got the cold noodles.  We gave them another few minutes and then just had them cancel it and they were like "Ok."  The food is good and the people are nice which is why I'm still giving them three stars.  But it wasn't busy and there was no reason that not even the mac salad was a no-show. No regrets but probably will try other places next time.

-fZA8I2u9bGiMP5VLbi-Sg.text: I enjoy this place and it is definitely a hidden gem in Las Vegas. They treat you like royalty and the food has a lot of flavor. If you like seafood they have plenty of dishes.

HJ7c4Jg5xDS5oHM9G6onDg.text: This restaurant is located in a not so good looking strip mall. When you enter inside its not much different. This is a very humble restaurant but with very good food. The service is also very good.  Their main dishes come with your typical Korean sides, which are all very good. We ordered the combo which comes with three different types meat. We also had the Bi Bin Bab, which is served with chicken broth.  Both dishes were very good, and as I mentioned before the customer services is also outstanding

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bi bin bab in hot pot

jUBy1SA-7Qfyx8T0db3ttg.text: We were on our way to try a new island restaurant until I realized that they're closed on sat-sun. Really? Who does that? Anyways...  We are here at Island Style and to be honest, a girl ain't mad, lol. This would be my second time here. Exterior, for some they might look at it be like what f*%! Is this place? But someone like myself who have seen many "Hole in the wall" "mom&pop" restaurants like this...think? I bet they got some bomb authentic food in there hahaha what? Let's just say, don't judge a book by its cover, okayy!!! Haha  You walk in, pick your seats...waiter will come with boiled peanuts, water and order any additional drinks. Following the waiter brings out multiple side dishes, kimchi, cucumber kimchi, cold bean sprouts, and I'm not too sure what the last one was  but it was good.   I ordered the spicy Korean chicken, The chicken came sizzling on a hot little cast iron dishYum. Boyfriend ordered the meat jun. De-lish! On my first visit I ordered the fried rice omelette. Friggin' HUUUGE portion. Holy sh*t the omelette could at least feed three people. Lets just say that I have never had anything bad from this little gem  I shall return one day and try something new. And you all should go and try it too....

g1bGd2VMQXksIjt4A-4C5A.text: First time here and we *LOVED* it. The Bi Bim Bop dol sot (hot pot) was fantastic.  I've been to a lot of places where they don't get the stone pot hot enough, so it doesn't crisp the rice at the bottom... the one sizzled for a long time and the rice was crispy and delicious.  The pan fried mondoo was very good... and the bon chon was great.  One of the better things I liked was the ko chu jun that was brought out... it was pasty and delicious.  Too many places nowadays bring out sriracha and try to pass that off as Korean hot sauce... not here... they give you the real stuff :)

_Yop0RPME2GFdmO7cggizA.text: Me and my lovely fiancee have been to this place twice and we absolutely loved their food. Price are cheap and the quality are pretty awesome. I always try their combo while my fiancee always try to venture out of ordinary. So far so good.  The server/owner Russel have been very very accomodating and friendly  as well as being a very nice guy to talk to.  I come back more often if its not too far from my home on the west side.

vXtE7xsKEFTwWyFSAFpRkg.text: As someone who goes back to the islands 3-4 times a year and hangs at the local spots, this is as local as it gets. Awesome island grinds with some Korean favorites, but also the awesome Korean appetizers. Food is ono, really tasty, generously portioned, and an excellent value.  Above all though, the service from the staff is warm, friendly, inviting and worth coming in for alone. For a taste of local island food or some Korean favorites, check it out.

PG6JUKl23-wvZ4tIdN-HpQ.text: Delicious! sweet and sour pork is great. Good value unlike the franchise restaurants.

Lttw7-huZir3jbYnPT1Q1Q.text: Really great food. Value for what you get, quality etc...for the price is hard to beat. Owners are amazing and it shows :) Big selection, fun for the family!

BCOAYHieZjnoh-qxIxVcdQ.text: My dad always needs Korean food on trips, so I found this place on yelp. As the reviews show, definitely worth a visit. May look kinda shady and closed from the outside, and it is in the middle of a complicated plaza. But don't run away. They have such friendly servers and the warm tea (boricha) is delicious - freshly brewed - I had 5-6 cups alone. I got the kalbi-tang and loved it.

jrDYFjq2ZL7g_82ClG2W2g.text: I really didn't want to write this but .... cockroaches!!! Food was good but soon as I saw a cockroach on the lower wall. That means kitchen would be full of them. They need to do a better job after seeing what happened with Firefly. Owner lady seems nice and service was good but i can't go back to restaurant with bugs!! Sorry. Please get rid of them.

97v25atI71-w5tWF3DeU9Q.text: ALOHA: 10/10 stars FOOD: 10/10 stars Location: still a 10  Party of 3: barely $30 We ordered: loco moco with 2 patties and 2 eggs with gravy ALL over, pork cutlet, & bul-go-gi. All soooo ONO!   I asked if they served dessert and Uncle straight busted out some cold asian pears, cut up and served on a platter especially for us.  THEEE BEST service ever period.  After moving to the mainland 7 months ago, this place sure made me feel like I was back home!! It's my new favorite place when I hit up Vegas!  So please, go check  em out!

lyWfS_JSxnlbEaEN3SrYfQ.text: My second first time.  I first came here in 1994, when I was a wee student homesick for some local kine grinds.  There was no L & L those days, so we'd have to make the trek all the way up Sahara to get here.  Short story long, no matter strong my craving, it was tough to get here and it was lost to memory.  Fast forward to 2010 and, thanks to Yelp and Misti Y, this place is back on my radar.  It's still a haul from my hood, but I HAD to give it a try.  Walking in the door was, well, strange.  It looked and felt completely different.  Gone was the darkness (not sure if they even turned on the lights back in the day), the drink cooler up front and the booths.  Apparently, three renovations makes a difference.  Anyway, enough with the memories and down to business: the food.  There were four adults and two kids in our party, so we took the big table up close to the counter.  We were readily greeted with boiled peanuts and juices for the kids (it was pretty amazing to watch how an entire can of juice can make kids bounce of walls).  We were also brought never-ending dishes of different types of kim chee, which always seemed to be empty when I looked for it.  The mandoo was especially tasty, definitely not the kind you get from the market.  Our meals were onolicious and no one left hungry or a plate empty.    I like this place, but it's so far out of my normal eating radius.  I hope to be back before another 16 years elapses.

Hc4YCmZPDcqEuOqxrj4wGw.text: Best meal I've ever had in Vegas.  Been to Vegas over 10 times in the past 15 yrs and have seen Vegas go from great cheap eats to highend style-over-substance restaurants.   If your looking for an honest delicious meal, and great personal service come here.  If ur looking for a subpar meal at a high price stay on the strip.   Recommended: loco moco, Fried mandu, kimchi, combo plate, fried rice (just like my mom used to do it, with spam!!).

8goaH7VUdW8SkdfPNF-c9Q.text: Great food and great service. I felt like I was the owner's personal friend. The teri chicken and ribs were delicious.  The meat jun was incredible,  but what really impressed me was the service. I felt like a guest in someone's home. That's how it's done!

aNvBN8R2QjLGdHBpJgaVRQ.text: What a find! Let's not bore you with the details on how good the food is, you can just read the rest of the reviews.   What I do want to emphasize is the service and the complete attention you get right when you walk in. He greets you and asks you if this was your first time eating here. If so he will give you recommendations on what to eat depending on your craving for the day. Checks in with you to see if your OK and he even shook my hand and said thank you when I left. This is how it should be at every dining establishment. He knew the regulars by name and it had a family atmosphere. I felt like I was at a 5 star restaurant even though I was in a mom and pop joint in a strip mall. Great experience!

ceUHscolB2idWJbNifHnXg.text: I was looking for a place to get some kalbi and came across Island Style. When I saw Michelle M's 5 star review, I knew I had to try it. Friendly service, small restaurant. Took us a little time to find it but we were thrilled when we did. Kalbi for me, Katsu for my friend. So delicious, huge portions. We couldn't even finish everything and we split it all. Good prices too! I will definitely be back!!!!

_m7DdQeGLd_ENfpoiG84QQ.text: Ono Grinds and Hawaiian hospitality from Russell and his wife (didn't get her name).   I love the food booth in Greenland but haven't made the stop to the OG location. What better than to go with the Yelp crew and have some Yelpalicious Dishes. Everything people ordered looked good.   I got a pork cutlet so I can try out some of their gravy. It's all about the gravy and a weak gravy makes for a okay dish. The gravy here was good on my katsu.  I was eyeing Misti Y.'s soup since she looked like she was enjoying it. Then like as if Russell reads minds, he brought us over a kimchee soup to try- that was pretty good and I gotta order that sometime when I'm feeling like soupy. The peanuts and banchans they served were also fresh and definitely tasted homemade.   They have more dishes here offered than their food booth so I will definitely stop by to try those dishes. Mahalo!

B_vFsn0-78bSh1DVvNt2Bg.text: Whenever I'm in Vegas, this place is a must stop!  I've tried almost everything on the menu.  They are all GOOD!!  They have Korean, Hawaiian, and Chinese food.  Surprisingly, they are all perfectly yummy!! Please try this place!! You won't regret!

pfCz5kY3j1YB_IO1bHXWjA.text: It is in the scary looking, old mall. By the way, they have great food. Everything I've tried was good. Price is very reasonable too.

0m5Lfa9alX5PvYMo0i8o4Q.text: My friend offered to take me out to lunch so we went to Island Style restaurant. The restaurant is small but has a T.V to watch sport center. I was really surprised when they brought us peanuts to snack on. The peanuts where really good and I ended up asking for more. The dish that I ordered was really good it was a combination plate. I will definitely go back to try other items in the menu.

FPXZAM1A5Mt4TL410ZidFA.text: I raelly really wanted to write a great review for this place, i love hole in the wall joints that are cheap and friendly...and thats what this is for sure.Not much to look at, and minimal decor. The food is in large portions, and tasty. The free boiled peanuts and the fried mandu dumplings were the highlights. Hot Rock Pot BI Bim Bop was soso, so was the combo plate...the BBQ and kalbi were the highlights of the combo. Nice service, very personable, friendly. I might go back, because of the funkiness and friendliness of the guy there, but the food was just ok.

MIhg5dE1TO_H_0MgkJf6uA.text: This is a real Korean restaurant, definitely serving the Korean community. My friend and I were the only white folks in this 20-year old restaurant, and got some weird looks from the regulars. Imagine a fusion of Polynesian-spam-based lunchroom, Korean kim chee joint and basic Chinese restaurant. Usually, when we hear "Korean," it's some sort of Asian BBQ joint. Not this place. Upon sitting down, you will get a number of different pickle-type appetizers. We got two types of kim chee, kelp noodle in a mayonnaise sauce that was quite new and tasty, boiled peanuts, and bean sprouts in brine. We ordered the pan-fried dim sum and it was adequate. We ordered the fried chili shrimp and the meat-and-seafood stir fry.  The waiter warned us that the stir fry was the real deal, with sea cucumbers (sort of a cross between mushrooms and squid, but slimy). And indeed it had sea cucumbers, but nice enoki mushrooms too. I'm honestly not a huge fan of sea cucumbers but as the wait dude promised, they help make a nice gravy. Both dishes had a mix of fresh vegetables and that staple of Polynesian/Chinese lunchrooms, mixed frozen vegetables of cut string beans, corn, cubed carrot and peas. I put that mix in canned chicken noodle soup to increase the nutrition content, but otherwise don't see much advantage to adding frozen mixed vegetables to real food.  Nothing to write home about; good solid food. I would be happy to try other items on the menu.

Afi32r5HqEycI-sCu6rMTw.text: The BEST Hawaiian / Korean food along with an outstanding friendly service!!!

FYzh2xYefIgG1WrptoLEDQ.text: Really good - generous portion size, delicious flavors, reasonable prices, and great service. Will be coming back!

hJFU_vOpSQh6Sqpwre5-7w.text: The food was fantastic. I had teriyaki barbecue beef. It was thinly sliced (bulgogi style). The texture was so soft. It wasn't the pre-chewed cheap Chinese beef soft, but really tender good-cut-of-steak-tender. The teriyaki flavor was perfect. It wasn't too strong. It was only 11.95 and they included the traditional Korean appetizers.  The kimchi was the best kimchi I've ever eaten. It wasn't too fermented, but instead had a great spicy, pickled cabbage taste.  A lot has been said about the service. They are extremely polite. They aren't especially attentive and you can end up waiting between refills or struggling a little to get their attention if you need something else. I did appreciate that they my friend and I right in front of a TV playing March Madness (probably because we're obviously American).  The great food compensates for everything else. I will definitely be eating here again the next time I'm in Las Vegas.

Pi4ckB-Qu_CWsBtAKRktWw.text: Can't go wrong with boiled peanuts. You gotta try the boiled peanuts!! This is where I go when I need my Korean fix. Awesome Kim Chi and Meat Jun. Fish Jun is Ono too.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo is da bomb!

vX-WdO_Md4cJRtgh-b6ymg.text: One of the best meat jun in town! Got the three meat combo with fried rice to go and it was awesome! Uncle even threw in some boiled peanuts! Man five stars all around. Good to go!!!

XjQZ0se2ZceIvNW2bG6cgQ.text: This place is awesome!!! Will definitely be taking visitors here for amazing Korean food. The sides were excellent and the service was great!

q-xqf9oXGoA-F-4b4idF-Q.text: If you like Korean food, you have to try Island Style's Bibibamp.  They have a variety of Korean, Hawaiian and Chinese food.

qb0m0DmoWtbXE0u3Kdqogw.text: Food is super killer here. My fav (since I'm not a beef eater): Fish Jun! But, based on other friend-made recommendations, you are probably still good trying either Jun; it's just so good!  I love the fact that they serve boiled peanuts when you dine-in too.  It reminds me of back home in Hawaii when boiled peanut was eaten so frequently that it was pretty much a staple already.  Hawaii-style Korean grubs done right.  Chill vibe, good grubs, and the ever present aloha-style hospitality.  Always a treat!  Mahalos guys!!

2ZR-iLEJtd6IKG04Z_3TtA.text: A friend told us about this place and I was very excited to try this Korean and Hawaiian fusion restaurant.  They had a range of dishes from loco moco to bibimbap.  We ordered the cold Korean noodle and their mixed BBQ platter which consists of the short ribs, meat jun and chicken breast.  You can tell they take pride in their BBQ as each piece was grilled to perfection.  I really enjoyed the meat jun (Seasoned ribeye dipped in egg before pan frying) especially with their dipping sauce.  The banchan (free refill) that came before the meal was also delicious, well seasoned bean sprouts, kim chee and radish. The owner/server was very nice to us and even gave my wife an extra cup of their specialty Korean tea to go.  We also had some fresh peanuts that just finished boiling in Hawaiian sea salt.  All this for $20, not a bad deal at all.  We will definitely be coming back to try out more of their menu items.       ________________________________________

wTetK2xKkxykl1cgIJgyEw.text: Went to Island Cafe for dinner tonight. Let me tell you this place is the real deal. Being born and raised in Hawaii I know the difference between Real Island Food and the want to be's. The combination plate was for real.  The boiled peanuts for pupu's made me think I was back home in Hawaii. Russell the owner is a real cool guy. Super friendly and makes you so comfortable.  If you hungry for Hawaii food head on down and try it. You will love it!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combination plate with fried rice.

aZdnaYY8TjtZSz0WW7luPA.text: This place is so good. The owner is so friendly and good with managing his customers. It's a mix of Korean food and Chinese food and Hawaiian food. I shared the neng myun, kalbi combo, mool mondu, and tang Soo yu. The neng myun was the best I've ever had. The kalbi combo was really good, it came with a fish that was really good. The tang Soo yu was very authentic and delicious. I would come here again!

sY7e-LN54togBGj-LuYXWw.text: OMG! This place makes the best Jjajjangmyun and Jjamppong! I'm in early pregnancy and crave for Korea Chinese food so bad, asked my husband to take home. My husband said the place was packed and no one asks him but seems like just dine in place. One Korean lady got a call through my husband, and I could tell her what I want and as well as take out option  I'm impressed! They put noodles in separate box, as well as Jjajangmyun sauce and another separate Jjamppong sauce. And Danmujee, onion and Kimchee in separate mini box. All look great and so glad noodles was separately packaged- and were great after traffic jam home!  I started having Jjajangmyun and already I am  too full with generous portion!   I called to say thank you for great take out, but no one answered. I'll definitely try some others next time.  Love their food! Wish this location is close to  where we live. Maybe next time I'll visit with a bigger belly! Thanks for making me feel great, eating great- I badly wanted great taste, even thought I wish I'm in Korea for those food. Glad to find this place!!!

_DcCJjl9V8FhhRPhUZCRMQ.text: OMG!!! This place is AWESOME!!! don't judge the appearance of the restaurant coz their food are SUPER delicious, could find anything in Seattle that could compare to this one!!! Their appt Kim-Chi is just great, not to mention the boiled peanuts as well. The owner/server was SUPER nice, after he knew we want to bring home some spicy cold noodles. He gave us the raw noodles and advice us how to make it at home with all their sauce!!!!   They are now one of our MUST-GO places when we visit vegas!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. don&#39;t judge by its cheesy appearance, their food are AWESOME!
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. great auth. S.Ko. meal

Qy2X0iBGwJJyy93nWjjE4g.text: Island Style offers excellent Hawaiian & Korean cuisine served by the nicest guy you're ever gonna meet. I can't think of a time when anyone went so far out of their way to make sure we felt so welcome and were so completely satisfied with our meal and dining experience.  Beyond that the food is 110% authentic, amazing and delicious.   We ordered a mix of Hawaiian & Korean dishes but every meal here starts out with complimentary Banchan and Boiled Peanuts. It's at this point you know your meal is gonna be something unique and special.  Appetizer -   Spam Musubi: Perfect Hawaiian guilty comfort food. I like to think of it as Hawaiian Foie Gras. :) Not the absolute best version I've ever had but still very good.  Entrees -     Hot Rock Pot  Bi Bim Bop: Perfect searingly hot bowl of rice, veggies, beef, sunny side up fried egg, chili pepper paste, served w/ a little bowl of sweet soup on the side to cool your throat.  Teriyaki Hamburger: My wife's choice for lunch and though it seemed a  pedestrian choice for such and exotic and extensive menu, she enjoyed it very much and I count her as a burger snob so it must of been good.  Side -   French Fries: Again my wife's order and they arrived hot, crispy and fresh which meant they didn't have a chance.  No trip  to Vegas from now on will be complete unless we make it here for at least one meal while we're in town. It's that memorable.  Go now and enjoy. The combination of food, service and the charm of Island Style are unmatched.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot Rock Pot Bi Bim Bop ($9.25)
