wR8hllgUxnfrBzhprtLfiA.text: My family and I went here and we aren't familiar with Korean food at all so we were pretty lost. The waitress and chef were super nice to us and helped us pick great food though (the hot bowl bi bim bap, the bulgogi, and the kalbi). They even dealt with my dad's terrible dad jokes and kept checking in on us. We really enjoyed the food and the service definitely deserves five stars. I'm glad we went here

S7PFFLSe8FKsMk63VCvLCg.text: I don't even know where to start with this restaurant. Every time I hit up LV I always subconsciously think, crave, want, desire everything on their menu. I highly recommend their kalbi & soondubu, bibimbap, spicy seafood noodle, tea water, and omgh just everything. The service is extremely wonderful and the owners are very welcoming. Clean environment, handmade warm food, and the taste of love in every bite. Not to mention they remember almost every customer and ask how things are going. A place who cares not only for the food they feed you but also everything else is a place worth going.

ThXAlACDD9vRK0OfzKQpmw.text: I'm back to visit and they are as delicious as before or better. The boil peanut Mac salad side dishes are kicking. Also,  they have all the island juices and the special tea.  I'll be back soon.  Good service reasonable price island atmosphere!

0-CYbCuayhmi_aN43O-CCg.text: Family owned and operated, this place offers an inexpensive meal with large portions and a great traditional Korean style appetizer spread. Don't let the exterior of the building fool you, this is great grub!   Hawaiian/Korean fusion so you can enjoy spam and eggs with Kimchi  1 -5 scale Food 5 (comfort food for the island and the Sole)  Service 4.5 Price $8 to $12 a head The atmosphere is a little like a dive, but the people and food are amazing.   Go loco mocco

Wwab_PkeRJ5kr7GUTHAkxA.text: First off i i want to wish Island Style a happy 19th birthday and congratulate them on their years of success!  This one is special.. I can always count on this place to make me feel at home with it's welcoming enviorment and super ono food.  Feels cozy just how i would imagine Hawaii to be.  Lately ive been getting the teriyaki salmon w/ brown rice, but my all time favorite and go to spot would be for their bibim naengmyeon. i haven't had it there for a while because i've waiting for the weather to get warmer, so i can enjoy it more.  But Imagine a cold spicy noodle dish on a hot summer day.   Mmmm, broke da mouth, cuz.  I can't wait to go back and get my fat on there as well as getting my spirit lifted by Russel.  You can tell he just enjoys life and it'll rub off on you too.  Mahalo!  *sidenote* My first review off my cell phone.

fssVAiISilTnaNGRXGU18Q.text: Let's start with the food. Quality is great! The taste is wonderful. The korean food is among the best iv ever had, and the Hawaiian food is comparable, if not better than most of the places I ate at back home in Hawaii. The owner is very welcoming and has great customer service

FoSXcKzvBbACre3D4a9Gtg.text: I love their Korean-style Chinese food. We had jja jang myun (noodles with black bean sauce), tang su yuk (sweet and sour pork with mixed vegetables), gan poong gi (Similar to salt and pepper pork with spicy peppers), and Sauteed vegetables and peppers with Chinese buns. Everything tasted just as good as the Chinese food back in Korea. There's always the same one server working there, and he provides great service. He's always responsive, attentive, and friendly. I'll be a regular :)

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gochu Japchae

BSIcpmlzpCiKQhnLtXF7Tw.text: Surprisingly, I have never heard about this place till one of my friends told me about this place. This place has been in Vegas for about 17 years (give or take) and have never heard about it till now! I'm from Hawai'i and I haven't heard about it from my fam and Hawaiian friends that live here. I only found out about it thru a friend (who's originally from NY). Maybe I use to go here with an ex and I just blocked it all out from my memory. Lol.   it's a small place, and easy to miss when your driving down sahara in traffic and all the construction. Once we got there, it was not busy, a quiet relaxing place to have a meal. They got a wide screen tv w/ the basketball game on.   We were greeted and served by the owner. He got the pidgin accent. I love that, always make me feel like I'm back home. the menu is simple, that's good for people like me who can love everything on the menu and have a hard time deciding what to get.   This is the first place I've been to that has fish jun! My favorite Korean-Hawaiian dish is meat jun, but I wanted to try this. I'm the adventurous type so I always like to try new things.   I like the appetizers here. It's different than other Korean restaurants. They got the kimchee, pickled potatoes?, and some other ones. They were all soooo good! I couldn't eat a lot of it, so I stuffed the rest in my take out box hehe. My friends didn't care for it, lucky me... I had it all to myself!   I appreciate it when the owners are able to serve and chat a little bit with us. it seems humble.   I told him I love meat jun, but this is the first time I've had fish jun. He said the next time we come in he'll make zucchini jun for us, right on!!! it's not on the menu.   The meat jun is pretty good, but Soon's meat jun  in salt lake, Oahu, Hawai'i tops my list. but this will be my go to spot for anything jun in Vegas.   Oh yah, I like that they give a delicious tea at the end of your meal, no charge. :)  One con is that it's a bit of a drive for me coming from east Henderson. maybe that's another reason why I've haven't heard about this place.  They've got other locations in Vegas, but this is the one to go to. Others have tried the other locations, and all said it's not the same!

HMhDTuz5mD6Gv9JpYm3SlQ.text: Someone please explain what I would have done before the advent of the smart phone and Yelp?  Eating a ton of terrible buffets in Vegas, that's what.  We came here after a friend suggested a buffet at Terrible's and my boyfriend and I were not in the mood for ANOTHER buffet.  After about 3 minutes of scouring the internet, we found this place.  Score.  I was a little worried at first because of the hole-in-the-wall look on the outside with reflective windows.  I thought it was closed at first but I was dead wrong.  I walked in there was wall to wall Asians everywhere.  Good sign.  I had the Hot Rock Pot Bi Bim Bop and my boyfriend had the Meat Combo over rice.  It was a great change up from what we normally do in Vegas.  If you have a car, it's just outside the strip and easily accessible.

DrGqgXEaiKr0oyHOXAsuwA.text: Russell is the best. Food is great too. Best Korean Hawaiian grub in the South West. Solid 5 stars for me.

Qywm-CH83aGL56MJlKLflA.text: They didn't want to serve us at 8:40 pm said they closed at 9pm.  I don't recommend going there - very rude.

c55Lb4zBpQzfLdcSLa5Z_A.text: Nice authentic Korean restaurant in Vegas.  Per one of the employee, they have been in business for over 20 years.  We ordered various items from the menu.  They are had two themes in common:  delicious and great portion.  Although I think the food is slightly a bit on the expensive side, the quality, portion, and service are worth the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. seafood soup noodle

aL6mRxxoA4bq1_VVmvrWoQ.text: If you are hungry, come here.  Gina and Russell have a great set up.  We have been coming here for at least 15+ years.  We are never disappointed in the food.  The portions are always huge.  Side dishes are brought to your table to munch on until the food arrives.  Always a good mix of side dishes.  And you can have as much as you want.  The service is a little slow at times, but the food makes up for that.  We rarely give out 5 stars, but consistency wise, this place deserves it.  Will definitely go back, and highly recommend the combo plate.

GupPBPC2FzyIr9xIyOsAfQ.text: I loved this place. There were 15 of us who came and they were very accommodating for us. The portions were big and they even gave us complimentary wontons. This place was great and I'd return again.

E-s5J1m4c1aqYq6mrS_xiw.text: I freaking love this place. I love coming to Vegas for Aloha Specialties because there aren't many Hawaiian food places in Cali. But we decided to try it and I never knew how well Island flavor could be done with a Korean taste. Came here the next day as well I wish I could give this place more stars.

gVzQG-KiSMewx5_3rhhrKg.text: solid meal. ban chan was fresh and on point, particularly the seaweed squares and bean sprouts (it's the little things, you know?). everyone was super friendly, which we don't always experience when we're out with our three-year-old. one of the ladies even showed him how to put rice on the seaweed and eat it right up =)  we had a full order of the pan-fried mandu (best dumplings we've had in a long time!), bi bim bap (had to get the egg overhard, per my midwife's orders to not have over easy eggs, but it was still delicious), and jjangmyeon (my husband's fave, which he said could've been spicier).   we left happy and full, what more can you ask for? thanks, island style!

Loh2oYvwW5nKTuUUjRDSIA.text: Ok, if you're here for the fancy ambiance, boy are you in the wrong place.  Both the exterior and the interior are as no-frills as it comes.  But, if you're here for some great food, then take a seat; you've come to the right place.  Remembert that, despite the name, this is mainly a Korean restaurant so, like most such restaurants, they brought out several small plates of assorted goodies.  I quickly polished off the three spicy dishes, and then decided I'd better slow down.  The waitress came and pointed at the empty dishes.  I thought she asked if I was done, and I said yes.  But then she brought out three new servings of the spicy dishes!  Oops, I guess she asked if I wanted more.  Then our orders arrived.  We had the bulgogi and the hot stone bi bim bap.  Both were outstanding.  I also had a spam musubi to try their Hawaiian food.  It was good, but nothing special.  A little light on the sauce, I think.  But that's okay, their Korean food more than makes up for it!

uJcaTYh_szQWAHxPyh-kQg.text: Korean style Chinese restaurant.  If you like the authentic Chinese cuisine, this is not the one for you.  But if you like jjajangmien, sweet & sour pork, and some other Koreanized Chinese foods, this is the best in town.  You will not regret to eat here once you are hungry for it.

-WX86KdYkUWgl9yjpeyOzw.text: Small restaurant in a not so good looking strip mall.  But the food is good and filling.  The restaurant owners/staff are soo very nice!  I had the combo.  I was very excited to try the meat jun because I kept reading about it on the reviews.  What I discovered was that its marinated meat, covered in egg and then pan fried.  This dish was pretty good overall but I would have passed on the teriyaki chicken.  I was really happy when I asked for a grilled fish but a small portion, the lady owner offered to make me just 1 grilled Corvina for a low price.  Sure!  And yummy mini grilled fish it was.  If I could, I would just eat that and a bowl of rice...and then just be sated for the day.

cL4iWO-PYNOH3cg6HG1txw.text: Amazing food.  Amazing customer service.  Amazing owners.  Very reasonable prices.  This place serves both Korean and Hawaiian food.  Love it here

d0gS0YMgZ8swTC7AMfR7dQ.text: Owner is really nice. He was the one who took our order and serve our food. Best kimchi I ever tasted and 1st time to have white seaweed salad which is really good. We ordered the combo. Chicken Bbq and kalbi is so tasty. Not dry like from other hawaiian restaurants. Big serving enough for us 2. 1st time to try meat Jun which is just ok. Spam musubi has a big slice of spam. Will definetly come back to try other items in the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best kimchi!

WjhAN7yOkyhGEw7o-r5f0A.text: Great little restaurant off the strip. From the time i walk in the door to the time i leave a smile never leaves my face. Very friendly staff and amazing food. On your first visit you can't go wrong with the combo plate, trust me, you won't be disappointed.

FaGK8X4tP5NMl3la31C9CA.text: Hands down the best jambong ever!! And I am one of the pickiest person you may meet when it comes to food. Excellent, friendly service every time you go. Food comes out fast and their portions are huge! Be prepared to be stuffed!

jDeuaj-K1Q6CqsBB6pBTAQ.text: This is fast becoming my favorite restaurant in town.  The food is authentic and the owners are so hospitable and nice. I love that they've expanded and now offer Chinese/Korean cuisine as well. I recently met up with some friends and we had chajhang myun ( noodles with black bean meat sauce) champhong ( noodles in spicy seafood broth) tang soo yook ( sweet and sour pork or beef .. They recommended pork .. This seems west coast .. East coast it's always done with beef) side of kalbi and everything was delicious! Portions are large and service was good. Cans of soda were only one dollar! I also did a takeout order of combo meat plate and oxtail soup. Wow the oxtail soup was so good I almost cried cause it really reminded me of my mom's. Anyway if you haven't tried them please go you won't be dissapointed :)

k3cvbecyBvmKCJZmelhCBg.text: I'm sad that I haven't had the pleasure of eating at this restaurant sooner. But i'm excited that I finally know this restaurant exists.   My first visit was on a Friday afternoon. I ordered take out. Since it was still Lent I opted for the fish jun (egg battered fish fillet-served with a soy vinegar sauce). While I was waiting for my food I got to chat it up with Russel. He was extremely friendly. By the time my food was ready I felt like I was talking to my uncle. My second visit I ordered the Meat Jun. Not as good as Hawaii meat jun but since I live in Las Vegas this is as close as it gets.   Extra stars for the fact that he remembered on my second visit that I like a side of siracha hot sauce. More stars for the fact that when I opened up my take out bag there was a surprise: boiled peanuts! Too bad Yelp will only allow me to rate up to 5 stars.   The restaurant is located in a strip mall and you can easily miss it. But if you do have the opportunity stop by. You won't be disappointed.

xYan_hr29iWFrk5L_LLw0g.text: Have I not review Island Style yet? Finding this gem and meeting the owner was definitely one of the most memorable parts of our trip to Vegas. The owner, Russel, was closing shop early that day due to a catering gig. We were super lucky to find the place and get there in time to relax and hide from the midsummer heat. On that particular day in Vegas, it was over 110degrees outside and we didnt have AC in our car. All of our sodas and bottled waters were on the house. He fed us like kings, suggested what he thought we would like and then cooked us even more food for free. The whole time he laughed with us and tried to get us to interact with the only other family in the restaurant. He was absolutely the sweetest. Russel took the orders, made all of the food himself., entertained us and prepared for his catering job all at the same time.  When he flipped the sign on the door to close, a man (he explained an annoying regular) came in sometime after and tried to make him feeling guilt for closing early. The terrible man kept nagging, "Why don't you want to feed my wife?" Russel fnally yelled at him and kicked him out. It was great. I wish all restaurant owners and workers were able to deal with horrible and demanding customers in such a way.  We can't wait to go back! Russels spot is a Vegas staple!

aKjYD_yiXzLtvUPUZzDg1Q.text: I love love island style!! One of the first restaurants we've been coming to since we moved to Vegas.  Best meat jun in Vegas hands doooown!! Bibimbap is sooo good. You can get it with beef or chicken. The hot stone Bibimbap is awesome too! Everything I have eaten hasn't let me down. Owners are wonderful people, always friendly and giving great service. Definitely recommend this place for Hawaiian/Korean food :)  10 STARS!   Ummmm.. Can you say jajamang?!? Well actually jajamyun or jajangmyeon.. whatevas..  It's sooo good and I'm so happy that they have it now!! Along with a Chinese menu too!

Cj78WhsvNd1JjMPcQxjOig.text: Jody, Mom and Russell you guys are awesome.    Meat Jun, Spam Fried Rice, Macaroni Salad, Loco Moco, Fried Saimin and the best Man Doo I've ever tasted.  The banchan are always good with extra care put into everything.  The most nostalgic thing is the complimentary boiled peanuts.  Ono!  No matter how busy, they treat you like family.  This is the best Korean / Hawaiian Plate Lunch place in Vegas.  Why?  Because they know how to cook, they use quality ingredients and they actually care about their customer and what they do.

ZmStur8XDRF1eVn8Inn7Nw.text: It was my first time here. As a foreigner from Istanbul, i love exploring new tastes from other cultures. First i did not want to go in because the outside view of this place is pretty lame. However, as soon as i got in i found out this place is a hidden gem! Russell the boss is very excited to talk to the customers and help them choose the best thing on the menu. He serves like a waiter at his own place and tells you all about Hawaiian food and how it's made. Long story's short, this place was listed as the first option when i searched for best local food, so do yourself a favor and go try it. You wont regret!

YWq6ddo-Gpfo4bTy-QyK1A.text: Love love love this place. Nice home cooking island food. I've had several Hawaiian bbq spots here in town, but everything about this place screams ohana. The owner, server, who referred to himself as "uncle" was so cool.  He was a laid back dude straight from the islands.   He suggested the bi mi bap in the stone bowl.  It didn't disappoint.  It was so good.  Only criticism is I prefer a soft or runny yolk, and it was over medium.   None the less, it was a cool hole in the wall that made us feel like family.   Clean and family friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bomb.

ubp_-RvOIbqLGBVEcrjeTw.text: Just delicious!!!!! Jody is very nice and professional at his job. If you want authentic Korean food this is your spot. LOVE It!!!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side dishes are so good!!!!!

RNXbiffAB6pb5gKwjCZQMg.text: Just ate here last night and my son is asking to eat here again. Food was delicious and customer service was the best! Definitely recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

57PXkKsq1N_w5a1OIsvR3Q.text: This place has the best jjampong and jjajangmyen.  We enjoy eating here.  The soft boiled peanuts are pretty yummy too. It may not be the fanciest place but the yummy food is plenty fancy for me!

VWVCNZPedH1oEOpR8c--rw.text: Super nice staff. Got the bbq combo plate. Meat jun is delish! Comes with the Korean side dishes too! Wash it down with that hot tea, mmmm!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BBQ combo plate

4m8DtVh-QHslV_b7Ui_YTQ.text: Hidden gem must try when in the area. Great food great service along with great price. Definitely will be back and definitely will recommend to family and friends.

f_VK6hWQcgsdeDmvzuQ7IA.text: Russell the owner is soo hospitable, kind and generous. And the food- Amazing!! The soonduboo jigae (spicy seafood soup) is soo yummy and so is the galbitang large portions, homey home cooked food really good!! Will be coming back again-

4DXhVpIxw7fvA5pyjg4tpA.text: Visiting Vegas with my husband.  He was in a meeting all day so I took a Uber and ventured out on my own looking for a good Korean place to have lunch. I had the black bean noodles and spicy seafood soup combo.  They are hard to find in MN.  It caught my eyes because I can have both dishes I one order.  The soup had large crab leg unshelled which I have never seen at other places, not even in Chicago where I grew up.  Had jumbo shrimp and so many seafood variety.  Black bean noodles were so fresh.  Served complimentary barley tea and abundance in side dishes.  Upon requesting for take leftovers she added rice bowl for free with many side dishes without additional cost.  The service was tremendous.  I was making a mess with the spicy soup so the owner brought a bib and gave a free Hawaiian frosty after.  Wow, it was worth the venture.  I didn't try the Hawaiian food but others who were sitting next to seem to woo and ahh.  Really enjoyed the food and great and generous staff!

ffb8buJ9sRgUotHqp5qaag.text: This is definitely my favorite Hawaiian restaurant in Vegas. For awhile I was hooked on getting their meat jun dish that's served with mac salad but exploring their other dishes has had me excited to come in as often as I can!  There are two big reasons why I love Island Style: #1. The service! Jody is the sweetest and most caring server I've ever met. He always remembers your order and greats you with a warm & welcoming smile.  #2. The freakin' banchan! If you don't know, banchan are small little side dishes that are served during your meal. That's an amazing bonus. They have the most amazing house made kimchee! Don't miss out.  For food favorites, I highly recommend: -hot stone bimbimbap -kalbi ribs -loco moco -spam musubi -sweet & sour shrimp   -cold soba noodles  On top of having an amazing Hawaiian menu be sure to explore their Chinese options!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uylG80EirFKivHgb0WhTEw.text: So happy to have found this little gem just off the strip. Makes you feel like you are a family restaurant somewhere on an island.    I had the bibimbap this time. Do yourself a favor and get it in the clay pot. Especially when it's cold out. The radiating heat warmed me thoroughly. Besides the usual little sides which come in abundance, I was offered Oksusu-cha aka. corn tea. Delicious.  So super friendly and welcoming. Don't miss it.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot, crunchy, yummy goodness.
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side dishes. Yes. Those are hot dog slices. Delicious.

DdxesxYq5J3PIDkv3s1glQ.text: My review is strictly being given to the service. We are from out of town and always come here. In the past we have received excellent service when the owners or their son is there. We came to day and by all means the place was not packed like we are used to seeing it. First the lady saw us come to sit and asked not to sit there that the table was for a larger party. Little did she know right behind us we have more people coming. She then was like oh ok. She brings up peanuts and leaves. Never asked if we wanted anything to drink. Goes on and helps a different table and leaves us there. 10 minutes goes by and she's going around asking people if they want re-fills. At this point we go up to the lady at the register and asked if we could get drinks. She seemed bothered said said something in her language to the other and still no drinks. A while longer finally the come to take our order and wasn't very kind. Needless to say we ended up leaving. The food is always great but after being treated the way we needed. We weren't able to stay. For my 8yr old to say the lady wasn't nice. This tells you something.

IeGVha0rwBTHMfiWpE-DjA.text: Great food, Great service , friendly owners, will be back for sure. Service was on point, and top notch, very talkative and cool.  I recommend this place to anyone!

1dMMAIEQOKYgWevesLLaHg.text: Came to this hole in the wall not thinking much of it. I was completely wrong, their menu which is two sided (Island favorites/Korean) was not too much nor too little, since I've haven't tried Korean food beside Korean bbq I decided to be adventurous and try out the Korean side. I ended up choosing the jampong?? (Spicy seafood noodle soup). I had no clue what it was but like I said today would be adventurous... not only was the bowl of soup HUGE it was delicious with just the right amount of heat!!! It also came with tangsyuk which is sweet and sour chicken on the side... also delicious but only had a few bites of it due to the size of the portions. Also tried on fried Mandu again delicious... overall this place completely took me by surprise and help me find a love of Korean soups... can't wait to try other selections!!!

u1Hr5TtCWMsj7tVvUdNpAw.text: Service was welcoming and friendly.  Food was freaking awesome!  Don't be fooled by the outside appearance. Yes it's a strip mall but that food....so good!  We had dumplings, bibimbap, the combo plate and kalbi ribs. All were fabulous. It was a great birthday lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalbi ribs
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dumplings
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bibimbap

bFAKPDH07ALWMVzBALoL2Q.text: I really liked their black bean noodle and spicy seafood noodle soup.  Both dishes were flavorful and the side dishes were very tasty.  Don't order their burgers though, go somewhere else for that.  The Korean dishes tasted way better than the food they serve at other places on Spring mountain.

LWjsc9tF34wY9TruQr9f3w.text: I love this place! It's seriously amazing! I always order the combination plate, it's enough food for two but I love it so much I just don't want to share!  I love how even when it is busy the service along with the food is still great and fast. It seriously feels like every time I eat there my food must of been pre-made just chilling in the back waiting for me with how fast I end up getting my food after ordering. I couldn't give this place anything less then 5 stars! If I could give it more I would.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KFDW91ASSnuFnhDHE75hHw.text: Been coming here on and off for the past 25yrs. It used to be more Hawaiian style plate lunches because the guy that opened it was from Hawai'i. His name was Ivan. Ivan had the biggest smile and was full of energy. I will never forget that first greeting from Ivan as my 2 sons and I walked in; "Eh, howzit brah? Sit anyplace you like." He would sit with me and my 2 sons and just talk story. I would bring my family 2-4x a week. Ivan would throw in a few extras and always treated us like house guests. I need to make mention because I miss him, he became a friend. He needs to be remembered. Gina (his wife) is from Korea. Gina made all the ban chan from scratch. Unfortunately Ivan has since past and Gina met another guy from Hawai'i, Russell. Russell has the same personality as Ivan. Very talkative and friendly ... Good for Gina! Hawai'i guys are, Ka 'oi ae!  Anyways, menu still has some island flavor to it but now the Korean offerings dominate - in a good way! We ordered 2 Bi Bim Bop hot pot - 2 kalbi plate - 1 bulgogi plate - 1 chicken katsu and a cheese burger w/fries for the kids. Bi Bim bop - I added Korean hot paste and it was silence until it was gone. No need talk, just grind'um be'fo get cold. Crunchy veggies, egg yolk melted all over the sweetness of the grilled bulgogi and the hot pot crisping the rice to perfection. WINNER-WINNER!!! The ban chan was very flavorful and fresh. I luv the cabbage/cucumber Kim chee - no fishy smell or  flavor.  Boiled peanuts - if you from Hawai'i, you knowz wat I'm talkin 'bout! YES-YES-YES!!! I was to busy eating my bi bim bop without coming up for air, I truly forgot to taste the kalbi ribs and chicken katsu. When I did remember, I looked up from my bowl and all I saw were empty plates (only bones left) and smiles, I knew they were satisfied. Bulgogi came with my order and it was moist, soft and tasted like it should; Sesame shoyu grilled with a hint of sweetness. Bias, yes I am. Did I ever have a bad meal here? Yes I did. But they always made it right! Food and service - especially if Russell is working - are truly worth coming here. Especially if you're looking for authentic Korean food offerings.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VQpB7c9P2124n_VqEJuj5Q.text: This was my first time coming here and I wish I lived in Vegas so I could come back more often!! The customer service was awesome and the food is amazing and authentic. They made sure our food was good and were so nice about everything AND gave us free popsicles when we were done. I felt like a queen eating there

qqXlyE0cA99XYb04vORwrg.text: I ordered delivery from here with doordash and they were so amazing in filling my order. They did not have one of the things that I ordered so they sent me two of something else that was similar. The food was amazing. I ordered Soondubu which is Soft Tofu Stew. It was just as great as the one I have back in Providence, RI where I moved here from. I am super impressed with their timely preparation of my food, their customer service and their cooking. Will definitely go experience it in person as well.

bKMN3PH6HZWPfk9vocHlaQ.text: Very pricey food, but it was pretty good! If anything, the amazing service is what would keep us coming back. Very comforting like back home in Hawaii. Very good with kids, family oriented. The mix plate was so ono..... however, not a fan of the meat jun. I grew up with Dong Yang in Wahiawa, anyone from Hawaii knows what I mean. But besides that, everything else was great!

wDJ0l7sigRGt3UOzZW8bVQ.text: Love this place. I've been here a few times and I always leave super full and satisfied. They give lots of food. My favorite is the dolsot bibimbap.

3R7iPBunkiay0QVFpm1Rwg.text: Came here Friday afternoon for lunch.  Great place for Korean, Hawaiian, Chinese fusion foods.  We orders Kalbi plate, neangmyun combo and champong chajang combo.  Decent smount of banchan served. Large cups of water. Great service. Food came out quick.  Kalbi was sooo good. My bibimb neangmyun was really good. Mool neangmyun was decent. Champong was full of seafood and pretty tasty. Chajang myun was decent.  I gave an extra star was awesome service. Our server guy was super nice, gave us bottled water to-go and nicely packed up our Kalbi leftovers.  Looking forward to visiting again! Thank you!

LxoEeh687EqGm_LtYXkPQg.text: This place is incredible. An awesome fusion of korean and Hawaiian food, you can without a doubt find something here for you.   The thing that absolutely makes this place is the staff. We were greeted by the owner who also told is some great sauce combinations for our food. They were friendly and courteous and really made you feel like you're part of their family.   The portions are large and delicious. You can't go wrong with anything here. We came in a large party, and I personally tried many things. I loved all of it.   If you're feeling adventurous and wanna get off the strip, definitely come here!

2kzIVl9si8R09ichPpNqLQ.text: This Korean / Hawaiian fusion serves generous portions. Definitely not for people that have small appetite. It can be challenging to finish your plate or bowl. I have been dining here for multiple years and haven't had a bad meal here yet. The servers are very very friendly and prompt. The owner is often present helping out on floor when needed. This establishment closes a bit earlier than its competitors. Parking is very limited and might have to park a block away and walk over. Most entrees are accompanied by your complimentary standard Korean "banchan" side dishes. The interior and furniture / fixtures can use a bit of a facelift but most of the returning guests that dine here aren't there for the aesthetics. Definitely recommend this place to friends and family.

VvK4v0RDRJOUfvHowuA57A.text: This place is awesome,  Great korean chinese food  I always get the shrimp fried rice that comes with black bean sauce and spicy soup on the side.  Spicy seafood noodle soup is really good  Sweet and sour beef is really good as well.  Portions are huge and everything Ive had above tastes delicious.

xRUQZ9nwGDbfvDR-Dop0sw.text: AWESOME Korean food. The dol sot bi bim bap was really good.   Service was excellent. Really nice people who go the extra mile.  Go here ...you will not regret it.

xiUbcf5Gv3xmLIm-u1mCjQ.text: What happened to my beloved Island Style!  It has gone Gangnam Style and totally not Hawaiian as we know it. More like korean with a hint of Hawaiian here and there.   Now I do love Korean food but tonight I wanted beef stew or curry or katsu. I got total Korean instead.   I did line the boiled peanuts and the banchan. I got my favorite soondobu and it is about 50% larger than a regular place so it was just right.   However this is supposed to be a Hawaiian Restaurant so for that it is three star. For Korean restaurant I would give it 3.5 or 4.   The problem is that the service is just not great.  Nice people, good food. Too busy for decent service.

6J7g5Dj9ewM6jvDl8CZ0Xw.text: Local love all the way! This place reminds me of home, Hawaii. I think we were served by the owner. He was extremely nice and told us he was from the Big Island.  I've been craving meat jun and boiled peanuts and got a double score when this place had them both! All the appetizers were delicious especially the kim chee. The mandu was also really good.   After we put in our order, the table next to us received hot stone dishes with eggs over easy.  Our mouths watered at the sight, since they looked so good.   The meat jun meat was really tender and had great flavor. Although, I thought it wasn't quite authentic since it had batter plus egg. I've typically had it with just the egg.   My husband got the spicy noodle soup with beef and vegetables. The noodles had great flavor and the base had the right amount of spicy.  I would have knocked it down to a 4 because of the Meat Jun, but the service was so good that it bumped it back up to a 5. He was even offering otter pops for dessert.  Aloha!!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boiled peanuts, kim chee, and other starters.
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat Jun
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy noodle soup with beef and vegetables.

BH9ya9GOcclhRo_ARcoTkw.text: one of our go to places not connected to a casino...  7-28-18  well worth it !  great food great service

bE2Fe3qt3t2BCkZizfm3Hw.text: This is a Korean style Chinese restaurant. I ordered the mapo tofu dish and was really craving the flavorful sauce that Chinese restaurants cook the tofu with. Much to my dismay, the tofu dish was pretty bland. I could tell that the vegetables they used were the frozen bag assortment of Chinese vegetables. Not very authentic at all. But I should have known coming into a Korean restaurant. Also, the portion size was way too big for one person- such a waste :/   3 stars because I think if I ordered Korean food it would have been much better.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mapo tofu. This huge plate took up almost a quarter of the table.

YzeaRObEv7G3yTlNN9Ew5w.text: Don't be fooled by the location and look of this place from the outside. It's a hole in the wall place :) The food was pretty good- Korean Hawaiian style. I loves the spicy tofu seafood soup.   The most popular dish is the combo plate, which includes teriyaki chicken and teriyaki short ribs, rice, fried eggs, and macaroni salad. The meat is marinated in a sweet teriyaki sauce and is cooked over an open flame instead of a grill. Other Hawaiian specialties include fried mandu, a cross between spring roll and wonton and Spam Foo Young, an egg concoction made from, of all things, Spam, a popular staple in the island.  The service was good, I will come back with my family to try some other things on the menu.

poiA_A7R6kUqwyoV5FvQvw.text: We been here a few times overtime we visit LV.  We love this restaurant.  As soon as we walk in, one of the server ask us that we can sit anywhere we like.  Immediately, we sit at the table. One of the server that took our order last time, recognized us right away.  Customer service is awesome.  We ordered beef tang soo yuk, jja jang myun, teriyaki BBQ plate and mul naeng myun.  Beef tang soo yuk was crispy and hot when I bit into it.  The sauce was awesome.  Jja jang myun was cooked perfectly.  The noodles were al dente and the black bean sauce was very delicious. The teriyaki BBQ plate was sweet and savory.  Mul naeng myun is always cool and refreshing on a warm day.  Have good amount of parking.  Will be back here again when we are in LV.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BYGUVIxSn136ApsC5uetoA.text: I rent a car specifically to  come here everry time im in vegas!  Was born in hawaii and this place makes the food just the way i remember from when i was a child.  Owner seems lime a nice guy as well.  Highly reccomend if you are not looking for a fancy meal..and just some good korean/hawaiian food

w8hDu9crAMQ4dHQaknXytA.text: This place is a good local eatery. The waitress was very helpful with ordering. They serve huge! Sorry, I was too hungry to take pics but recommend if you're looking for island/Asian fusion.

KcioZ-MkDmYeT9IxEzUS5A.text: Best Local place to eat for Korean & Hawaiian food (& Chinese). All menu choices delicious & yummy. Excellent server & friendly service. Add to your list & set your google map to take u ther.

v3C9fUYC5pZW9BcA5OUuDQ.text: So I've been coming to this gem of a hole in the wall for years but this is the first time I step out of my comfort zone and tried something new. I had the black bean noodle and let me tell you it was the most amazing non meat dish I have ever tasted. The flavor of the black bean sauce is sweet mixed with the right amount of savory. The veggies taste fresh and crisp cooked just enough to hold the flavor. I was truly taken a back. The customer service is always warm and friendly and they are all willing to answer questions and be attentive. This is exactly how every small business needs to be from food quality to customer service 5 stars from me.

hvQGk1U9IRXWqRZgCR0rNg.text: Finally, the real deal!  I met the owner and Chef, she's a sweetheart and a very good cook! The place was filled with Asians, which is a GOOD THING. If the people of it's own ethnicity are eating there, than you know it's a good staple of Korean Cuisine.   There's plenty of room to sit, and they start you off with KIM CHI, Cucumbers, and Boiled Peanuts for appetizers. Nice veggies to wet the palate. I had the Combo dish, which was outstanding!! Teriyaki Chicken, grilled Short Rib, and an Egg fried Steak over white rice served with the perfect Hawaiian Guava Passion fruit juice drink.   I tried my wife's dish which was the Spicy Pork with white rice. FIRE!! ABSOLUTE FIRE! Perfectly tender pork loin smothered in a spicy/sweet sauce. I tell ya, the taste of that had me smiling.   Customer service is VERY GOOD! They are all very helpful and fast, so please be ready to order!  I had made this rating a 4, and changed it to a 5. Because now that I'm writing this review, I want some more good food and good service.  Nice work guys!!

l-Qn3uqKGRwQ8bPtcv8tbA.text: The best fried rice I've ever had!! They serve it with a Philippine sauce that is AMAZINGLY delicious. My husband and daughter had dueling forks over the last grains left on the plate. I wish I could take this home with me but unfortunately we are on a road trip. I will definitely be seeking out a similar restaurant at home in Portland.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best fried rice I&#39;ve ever had!! They serve it with a Philippine sauce that is AMAZINGLY delicious!!
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All kinds of interesting little sides were brought to our table. Not sure what half of it is but its complimentary.

utmtg8du-sPCzoPiHNzwjw.text: I went there yesterday and ordered togo since my baby boy was sleeping in the car. Owners were so nice to delivery my good to my car curbside, take my credit card, then proceed on to give me 2 water bottles for free.   I ordered the jjajangmyum and meat jun combo with rice rice. Food was so yummy. Best jjajangmyun I had in awhile. Was just as good as Young King's in LA.   Awesome service and food. Going back there today before we leave to go back home.

lqmXXlDtIq4-mI7pZ3wiwA.text: Wow, thank you Gina  and Russell.  The two of you were super last night.  We had the boiled peanuts which were very good.  The fried rice was very tasty.  The bibombop was good.  The fried mandu with pork was yummy.  The fried tofu was good.  The combo plate included kalbi, meat jun and chicken teriyaki.  The kalbi was sooo good, the meat jun was very nice and the chicken was good, albeit a bit too bbq'd.  The omelet with spam and onions was good.  All of this for three for $46!!!  What a deal!!!

DO6QlcdGEh9YsWpRqfRidQ.text: I came here having high expectations for their meat jun from what I was reading. Unfortunately, their meat jun didn't quite meet my expectations. Their meat jun is really good, but I have had better where it was nothing short of amazing.

iIxlxhIdwm-hhPi2J3Edkw.text: Got the meat combo.  Liked the chix, kalbi was ok, meat jun was a little dry.  Liked the kim chee.  Boiled peanuts was a first for me.  Not bad.  Like to go back and have the soup.

tmdYWanzLOM3_ngqRwqGwA.text: This place is like a Hawaiian style Korean restaurant. The food here is tasty. I gotta say the kim chee is fresh and very very good. This is one of the only places that serve meat jun. I will definitely be back. aaalright!

yXyX_RZ-eJNRkC-fIhT2cA.text: This place is legit. Don't be fooled by its off-putting reflective glass - it's definitely friendly/homey inside.   The owner is genuinely super nice and hard working.  At his suggestion we had the combo plate that came with kalbi, beef jun, and bbq chicken.  We substituted the chicken for spam because...well...spam's delicious. We also ordered the chicken katsu which was very good and not dry at all.  Both meals came with rice and home style mac salad.    I love the korean fusion aspect of the place too.  The owner brought us some kimchi/pickled cucumber and radish/bean sprouts. Lovely. The fried dumplings (mandu) were also korean style and YUM.  Everything tasted great and we had that warm fuzzy feeling you get from those real hole-in-the-walls after we left. What else can you ask for?

ZKkxRPm59KhB2yEO-1pR4w.text: i could write a long review about the great food and service but most reviews already got that covered. the combo was the best hawaiian bbq i've ever had. Meat Jun is the highlight. you have to try this place it is awesome

rBQ-qS4z0rjhHBr58nuZUQ.text: YUMM!  This place is hands down my favorite place to get local-style Hawaiian food in Vegas.  (I'm from Hawaii) I've been to Island Style three times and will definitely be back. I'm slowly working my way through the menu. haha.   Ok for starters, the place looks sketchy from outside, but inside is bright and welcoming.  The owner/host is super friendly and makes you feel right at home.  First you get hot tea, warm boiled peanuts if they have any, kimchi, and a couple other korean appetizer munchies. ... and you get a LOT of it (and it's all free!). The owner is quick to notice if your little dishes get low, and will bring refills and send you home with more if you want.    I have tried and recommend the eggs, rice, and portuguese sausage plate, the fried rice, and the meat jun plate.  happy eating :)

hZUM6ZGXri1FQZ0aO8GqCw.text: great for the price! i also got the combo with the one kalbi, meat jun and chicken teriyaki. kalbi was excellent. meat jun was a bit sweet but not bad. chicken was good but a bit well. the bibimbop was awesome! yes, i had  2 combos and 1 bibimbop for $31. I want to try the soondabu (spelling?) next! yes, boiled peanuts, barley tea and the soup that came with my food, whatever it was, was so TASTY awesome! The kimchi was good! I don't really care for the radish kimchi but it tasted like what it should. For the price and the food quality, it can't be beat. Also, though it was busy, the Korean lady was quick. She was sharp. I will come again!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. combo
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SexU9tU2SsiX_z42475snA.text: Peas and Carrots.  Bevis and Butthead. Somethings go together well.  Korean and Hawaiian don't in this case.  Located in a strip mall with a lot of parking, this place has about 16 quad tables.  There are 8 of them side by side in the middle of the room so you can put several parties of 8 easily, so it's group friendly.  The menu is mainly Korean, but for some reason, they choose to put the word Island in the name of the restaurant giving me the impression they were Hawaiian.  We had the BBQ combo and the Pork Katsu.  I was looking for the Hawaiian aspect, but ended up with a Korean aberation of Hawaiian food.  The katsu sauce was more like a ketchup sauce or a shrimp cocktail sauce.  The pork katsu was over cooked and dry.  I suspect the cutlet was under a heat lamp i.e. precooked like a mickey dees.   The Kalbi and BBQ chicken were good.  The meat jun is coated with egg and like the cutlet, I seemed like it was a heat lamp item too.  It didn't have that freshly made taste.  I was disappointed after reading the good reviews.  If I come back, it would be for the Korean food because the photos on the wall look really good.  Maybe they should change the name of the restaurant to Seoul Style to give the customers a better description of what you're going to get.

eGNx0hV5HXejgRE7GX-AsQ.text: My family and I eat here at least once a month. Food is just like back home in HAWAII. Love the boiled peanuts and the cucumbers. Above and beyond customer service!!! A friend recommended this place and he was right! Aloha kitchen and L&L have nothing on this place!!!

K4uvwgBK1vSfzfEkX8bvwg.text: Great Hawaiian-style food here, just like back home. The kalbi is expensive but really yummy and worth the price. The boiled peanuts are also great, I totally miss them and they hit the spot. Great place for anyone stuck on the mainland away from home!!!

6Rvn0XO8GGNZkBNPdoSLdg.text: Yummy hole in the wall.  They have really good fried fish plate.  And the cold noodles are delicious!

CSaTRDIijfNLsCvIrp8FcA.text: The food here is consistently great.  One of the few Hawaiian/Local Style places I will go to.  The service is awesome.  The owner works the entire floor and makes you feel right at home.

ozUwNhyLeP84yMWm4mMsWg.text: You could drive by here a million times and not see this place. Totally hole in the wall. It has a Hawaiian and korean mix. The oxtail soup is tender and I don't even like oxtail soup. The Hawaiian food is pretty good overall also.

MKbIIcSRyzYvFy4R-56TqQ.text: I have to admit looking at the place, was a little unappealing. Once inside, however, Russell outstanding customer service. We ordered the bimbo bop, the Kim chee fried rice, the saimin, loco mock, and the oxtail stew. All the dishes were simply scrumptious. I thought the food here was better than some of the local places in Hawaii! If you want excellent food, and a caring server, this is the place!

vCxUww3lWH0dwuvbi6wr-A.text: Customer service is king here, the owner seems to know everyone who walks in.  This place is straight up Hawaiian.  The people eating here are Hawaiian and the owner also has that Hawaii Pidgin English.  I got the combo, which tasted good, can't go wrong with meat.  We also got the kimchi tofu soup, which was ok, had better, but still ok.  The customer service here is nice, and I would come here again if I felt like eating Hawaiian food.

6ctZCKj-_nkPoA5iSZKikQ.text: awesome food!  yummy combo just like hawaii :)

ODhqRp8ka5je0UxfOEu8Ng.text: My sincere thanks for the Yelpers who led us to this jewel!  The owner stocks the genuine Hawaiian Style drinks and I got a hit of my favorite which was guava.  Got the kalbi  and this much mentioned meat jun.  I started in on the kalbi, tender, well-marinated, very satisfying, but really loved the kimchee and the diced pickled radishes that were served first.  Then tried DH's meat jun.  OMG!  This is a new flavor and texture for me AND it was fantastic!!  Thinly sliced ribeye covered in egg that was fluffy that you dip into a teriyaki sauce.  The owner came over and added some bean sprouts and ate everything for under $20!!!  Worth the cab ride off the Strip.

eKytPZU9L5XTXRQYeOvmRg.text: This place rocks!!!!  Russell, the owner, is a great guy and very friendly.  He always shoots the breeze with us when we go in.  He shakes your hand and treats you with the utmost respect.  He always gives the island talk to my son and makes him feel specal.  I would recommend anything here.  Hot pot bi bim bop, meat jun, fish jun, chicken catsu, combo plate..........whatever.  It's all great.  I've had a couple of their soups and they are awesome.  Their kimchi is the best I've ever had.  I've had a lot of kimchi, and most of it has a little too much of the off/fermented taste for me.  His is just right.  He uses the same process for his radish to.  Their loco moco is fantastic and the brown gravy has just a tiny amout of sweatness to, like it should.  My son loves the spam musubi here, he'll eat it til he is sick.  Me, my wife and son will go here and eat til we are stuffed and it costs us $25 to $30!!!!  I will go by sometimes on the way home from work and get their kimchi, sprouts and macaroni salad to go just to have them at home.  A couple times he has refused to charge me for this because we are loyal customers.  I end up having to just lay a $10 on the counter and run out.  Russell understands what the word "customer" means!!  I would recommend this place to anyone that likes island food.  LONG LIVE ISLAND STYLE!!!

8BDHalf7hRK1WZZVhThQdA.text: The food here is AWESOME. Make sure to eat here before you embark on your 4-hour-drive home. Ate here once but the owner/waiter treated us like regulars. Real Hawaiian food and real service will make you feel better after a rough weekend in Vegas. Seriously.

L11OvNACDry2ZdXtdz7WRA.text: Everything about this place is awesome. Food and service!   I came with a group of 7 girls and they were very accommodating even though it was a smaller restaurant. We first get water right away and all the banchan (free korean side dishes to compliment the entrees or just to enjoy alone)  I ordered the combo plate with meat jun, BBQ chicken, and kalbi. So much flavor and cooked perfectly (not overdone or underdone)! Definitely dip the meat jun into the sauce!  Next time I want to try the Jjajangmyeon (black bean noodle), the mandu (korean dumplings), and the Naengmyeon (cold noodle) which is always so refreshing in this HOT Vegas weather.  Can't wait to come back!

rUOsAEkBDhSGagpkyGQVDQ.text: Good food and great friendly service.  We mainly go for the jjahm-bbong (Chinese-Korean Spicy noodle soup) but sometimes we get their Hawaiian or Korean as well.  Everything tastes good and portion sizes are huge.   I would've given them 5 stars but the last time we went they added 18% gratuity for a table of 5 (2 adults and 3 kids).  WTF?!  Plus it was the owner who served us.  We typically tip 20-25% anyways so it was their loss... But WTH is up with an auto 18% gratuity for a family of five??

UDF25U7gM0zT2V8klx8NOQ.text: Russell strikes again... With super friendly island hospitality, no wonder we keep on returning to enjoy Island Style every time we visit Las Vegas! Not only was the combo amazing, but the Saimin was to die for too. He served us Korean Polygonatum tea, which has a mild and  unique toasted taste, but this time he also offered a whole sour kimchi plate that was incredible and super flavorful.  Our favorite is still the beef jun, which is a lightly breaded thinly sliced beef steak with flavor to spare, it simply melts in your mouth.  You cannot get better service anywhere else, Russell is simply the warmest and most generous restauranteur you'll ever meet, he really loves to share his island cuisine with everyone, and not only leave with a super full stomach, but we leave happy as we just had visited a friend's home.  Island Style is unique in every way, and you must make it a stop in Las Vegas... It sure beats buffets, because you never leave hungry, and they take real good care of you!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Storefront sign
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Saimin

myIWVOO1Zv7tFqAxgdoD7g.text: I can definitely see why this place gets such solid 4.5 + stars reviews.    The food is excellent and Russell is the coolest and warmest host ever!  Don't let the unassuming location/restaurant exterior fool you.  Everything inside - the food and the people will surprise you in delight.    My fiance and I shared a Combo Plate.  Russell didn't mind at all and even offered us extra Mac Salad.  The chicken, the egg beef, and the short ribs were full of flavor.  The banchans were so good, I could eat them with rice by themselves!    We actually tried going back this past Sunday but it was closed.  We were so disappointed!  But we will definitely visit next time we're in Vegas again.

Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 of the Combo Plate
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free boiled peanuts!!!

raGpce9q88Aztd1oE0NkPw.text: I'm guessing the owner was serving us. He's super motivated and very welcoming. Wanted us to try everything and gave us taste testers haha! I'm so full!  Had the Loco Moco and the hamburger seasoning was on point!   Might look a little shady from the outside, but the hole in the wall joints usually serve the best food!!

sxH3OBQiQq7skYT3MR2Lvg.text: I'm born and raised in Hawai'i, and live in Des Moines.  When I get to Vegas, first grind stop is Island Style.  Dude.

CryVFhXEzM3Mq_CC5TRhvw.text: Cousins, boyfriend, and I were planning on going to Mochiko Chicken down the street but they ended up being closed before their closing time. But I'm glad that they were or else we would not have stumbled across this gem of a place! It really was amazing. Everything was good, from the service to the side dishes, and the main meals. Every single one of us were happy with our dishes. The spicy chicken and squid were fantastic, as well as their wonton soup and kalua pig and cabbage. This will definitely be a new Korean spot that we will visit more often!

nyJ1-JbtTIl9-iM58-AIQw.text: It was interesting. I've never had Korean Hawaiian food before. It looks like people buy kimchi and other ban chan in bulk to go here too. I might go back and try other dishes before I completely write it off, but I wasn't impressed.  Ordered: -Combo plate w fried rice -Mool naeng myun (cold noodle) -Chili japchae  The combo plate was the best bang for buck. The galbi, meat jun, fried rice were all good.. not amazing. Mool naeng myun was terrible. I usually don't order it unless I'm really in the mood, because I haven't found many places outside of Korea that can make this well. Unfortunately, I happened to be in the mood for it. Sometimes I can tolerate it by adding vinegar and mustard to cover most of the taste. This one didn't taste like much of anything even after adding the mustard and vinegar. Probably one of the worst / bottom five.  We ordered chili japchae which we thought was regular japchae with peppers to add a kick. Instead, it was stir fried onions and peppers, which confused us. It tasted like a thai dish I've had and was pretty good, but not what we expected at all.  The kimchi was good, so I wouldn't mind buying this to-go.

wqrfdidtJQXLjSdK8RMH9g.text: I visited this place on vacations. This was my first experience with chinese food and let me say i would never come back to this place! I couldn't finished my dish. The second star is for the waitress who was a nice lady.

M0svcXnvDLKu6_RF-i8dmg.text: Came here due to the 4.5 star ratings on yelp and ordered 3 combos to go. The inside is plain as a small asian restaurant should be (you won't get that unless you're asian sorry). The staff were very courteous and gave us complimentary peanuts and tea as we waited for our orders. They even came around to check on us and refill our drinks (remember we're a to-go order there really is no obligation to serve us).  The food was good. Meat jun was eggy and delicious, the meat was pretty tender and flavorful, and the kimchi was strong and funky. There was plenty of rice and for the price and location this was a good cheap lunch. I'd definitely recommend this place for those who are looking for a relatively inexpensive lunch option.

AvJp__OeIUrgp_ctH-tKbg.text: LOVE Island Style restaurant! A hidden gem that is sure to please your appetite and cravings. The place has so many options with traditional Korean food and authentic Hawaiian plates, you're guaranteed to leave with a full tummy and a smile on your face! Having tried almost everything on their menu, I can say I enjoyed my meal every time! So delicious!  Best musubis in town. Favorite things on the menu are Korean tofu stew (doenjang jjigae), meat jun, oxtail soup, and buckwheat noodles in cold broth (mool naeng myun). The mix plate (Kalbi ribs, chicken teriyaki, meat jun) always hits the spot too.   The staff and owners make the experience complete..they treat you like family! I've been to the restaurant by myself a couple times and the owners make you feel so welcomed and comfortable! I feel like I'm at home when I'm there.

TYOmfDyrwORTANxcbluf9g.text: I'm from Hawaii and I was CRAVING KOREAN HAWAIIAN FOOD. All you need to know about this place is that it is 100% legit. It also has the best service I've experienced since I've moved to Las Vegas. I took my (white) boyfriend here and prior to eating here, he never had Korean or Hawaiian food before, so he was pretty nervous and didn't know what to expect. We were both also starving. He absolutely LOVED everything he ate. He also ate kim chee for the first time and really like it. I was super impressed! He also ate all the spicy cucumber.   We basically ate everything that was on our plates. It was so ono I could barely handle it. My boyfriend loves me for taking him here and he definitely wants to go again. This restaurant made our night. I'm really happy with my experience here. I LOVE meat jun and I just kept smiling with every bite I took. Usually when I eat out with my boyfriend, I let him finish whatever I can't finish on my plate. But this time, I HAD to finish ALL of my meat jun. It was THAT good. I'm serious, you guys. He went in to finish the rest of my food because he's used to doing that for me but I just gave him the death glare!!! He said, "How bad do you want it?" He already knew I had to want it really bad for me to not let him finish it.  THAT'S HOW GOOD THIS FOOD IS!!! YOU NEED TO TRY IT!!! NOW!

apmDMj_uOT0iqKAd4RM0aw.text: This place has amazing service. Russell is so welcoming and a great guy. Gets busy sometimes but for good reason!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bi bim bap!

B-ejwxrQPGeE4Ka99jlnig.text: So I came into this thinking that I would literally die of awesome because it had come so highly recommended and it had always been on my "to try" list.  I guess for some huge carnivores this place would be a huge godsend because omg meat meat meat but I honestly thought that the food was just okay. The combo plate meat was meaty and delicious but the mac & cheese that came on the side was insanely salty -- not exactly even meal quality.  Overall...overrated and not worth going out of my way for.

PUhopASuf-tzy1EjRoLSGA.text: I have been going here since high school and still come here every time I visit Vegas! Love their mool-naeng-myun!

Hx677DdVL5Ql5u-onGHAOA.text: Came here for the Meat Jun and left with so much more.  First off, the banchan consisted of the standard cabbage and radish kimchi PLUS boiled peanuts! The boiled peanuts were delicious and complimentary! I had to refrain myself from eating too much so I still had room for the meat jun.  I got the combo, which had the chicken teriyaki, galbi (short ribs), and meat jun. The chicken and galbi is juicy, tender and flavorful, but the meat jun was the real centerpiece.  Meat jun is a fusion dish originating from Korean immigrants in Hawaii I believe. It's basically a tender piece of marinated beef pan-fried with a beaten egg. The marinade is a little sweet and has some soy sauce flavor. It compliments the tender, juicy beef perfectly. Add an egg and it's a unique and tasty dish! Highly recommended!  The tea they serve is very good too. "Polygonatum tea" apparently.  Lastly, the service was amazing. The waiter/owner was very attentive with tea refills. He also told us about his experience in Hawaii, the special tea, and the meat jun.   One of the greatest restaurants in terms of food, service, and even artwork on the walls! Try the meatjun! You won't find it anywhere else!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo

eecRSOSsVv3z6C_9QTz1cg.text: By far thee best!! Im a regular here and the staff knows us. Lunch and dinner.. Always fresh always good quality and the staff is on top. Love all the appitizers served, recommended to anyone who wants good quality food!

5bMLnN3KgwyWaDeXYGyTnA.text: The place's location is a bit sketchy but if you go for Jja Jang Myun noodles, you won't be disappointed. I went with a friend that was absolutely negative about everything which ruined the experience. Never again with this fellow but yes with the food! Order the Jja Jang Myun!

vEg3v4xcq74b7bpqRzfz4g.text: This place is in a stranded-looking strip mall, with a rather dingy looking sign. But don't judge a book by its cover because, I did, and I was proven soooo wrong.  Island Style is a Hawaiian/Korean fusion restaurant, but more towards the Hawaiian-side in my opinion. The kind lady that runs the place is Korean and tends to make your food more "Korean" (if that even makes sense) if she knows that you are Korean.   The food is FREAKING awesome. A bit on the sweet side, but I seriously can't complain. Had the mul-bi naeng myun (buckwheat noodles 2-ways: one spicy, one with cold broth), the summer noodles, the spam fried rice. I can honestly say that you probably can't go wrong with any order.  This place is a must-try if you're in Vegas.

5_Cfuis8fOYm2HU7zF0Zwg.text: Nice casual place to get some grub. We stopped by before starting our drive back home, so we were the first ones there that day. The guy there was really chill, but helpful.  Food was good. The kimchi and other items they give you to munch on were excellent.

-eGMXDCTJskwLMVMDpZcnQ.text: Food was excellent! Boiled peanuts! Had the Kalbi, bulgogi, oxtail soup...lots more! Service was excellent! Host was the best! Will come back whenever in town !

I1QepbW6Ma7xLaRw0R1nfA.text: If you are looking for Ono grinds that remind you of home cooking on the islands, this is the place. Boiled peanuts are a nice surprise. Good service. Cabbage, turnip and cucumber kimchees are delicious.

jAc__JvI5KsahD-Fqjqjvw.text: Had to try this place with all the great reviews.  I had the fish jun and was not disappointed.  Lots is side dishes and boiled peanuts too!   I'll definitely go back the next time to try some of their Korean dishes. Service was fast and friendly too.

9PMWDDoa2Wq2WfK8Xkb4mQ.text: Great food and great service! The owner is very friendly and made you like like you're in Hawaii. Combo plate was wonderful and the fried Mandu is a must!

_xeuumdaPAJfCEiIRzqWDg.text: My first time there... I got the Meat Jun (Beef) and it was very good.  I would order it again.  Then again... I like to try different entrees, so who knows.  The place was casual, nothing spectacular, the wait staff was quick  and friendly.  Pricing was very reasonable.  I'd go back without hesitation.

q5ImLFLqZZEQBfCutMyIVQ.text: My favorite casual local spot! The Korean food is good and inexpensive, with lots of little branch an sides which they will usually refill at some point. The owner recognizes me, and can usually guess my order :) I have never tried any of the Hawaiian food, but the hot stone bibimbap and the spicy seafood soup are both yummy!

KlgJlq6xVxhSfYIlf3zllQ.text: Got off work and really craving for a korean/hawaiian bbq. Came across this on yelp so i went to have an early dinner since its the nearest kbbq from work. Went in, it was quite busy. an old lady greeted me while she was cleaning tables. But she didnt really say if I should just get a table myself or wait for someone to have me seated. After about 2mins of standing there, i finally came up to her while she was still cleaning a table and ask, she was like "for here to go?" I said for here and she said, oh ok please have a seat (while pointing on a table for 4 on the corner). Sat down and a young lady came up, gave me the menu, and ask what I wanna drink. Her smile was very welcoming so I forgot about the earlier incident. A minute later an old man came up and brought my water, convincing me to try their iced tea instead. But no thank you, im good with iced water. He was very friendly and the whole time i was there, he kept checking on me, but never refilled my water. As for food, food is ok. A little pricey. I ate by myself but i felt like I paid for two. I had the combo which has kalbi, meat jun, and chicken that comes with white rice and mac.. Banchan doesnt have my fish cakes! Huhu. Banchan only consists of kimchi, cucumbers, and bean sprouts. I was so sad. I want my fish cake and tofu! lol. I didnt finish all the meat jun and chicken so i asked for a to go box. The old man came back with a to go box full of rice and he said "for your dinner" how nice of him! I wanna give this place 4 stars at least, but the food is too pricey, ive had kbbq on same average of taste and quality or better. Just a couple more bucks, i could have had an all u can eat kbbq.

oNpup7Q26FVsS9pjTsTUpw.text: I was in the neighborhood for lunch and I was so pleased the other day when I first experienced this place, so I came back for more!  The owner remembered me and had that same pleasing and chill attitude! Brought over the boiled peanuts quickly and took my order promptly as well:  Fish Jun: Alaska Pollock Fish Fillet dipped/wrapped in egg! I loved the Meat Jun so I wanted to try the fish version this time. Well, it was the same difference!! So Mother Freakin' Good!! Soo "ONO" as the islanders would say! Once its dipped in their sauce, its a done deal. I had to ask what was the origin of the "----- Jun".... The Owner told me that it was Koreans in Hawaii that started making this back in the day.. Gamsahabnida! (Thank you!) Koreans from Hawaii!   I was also brought the napa cabbage, radish and sprouts (korean sides). On top of that, a small bowl of hot Saimin soup to cleanse the palate. Nice!   Again, A Completely Positive Experience!!

SpivZT_M5xBKmt_AQpvKhQ.text: I just wanted to give a quick update after eating here several times the last couple months.  -The service is beyond amazing.  -The price is stupid cheap. -The food is simple, but wonderful.  Every time we've been there, Russell, the owner. has been beyond friendly, especially to our daughter, who is 5. He talks to her, plays with her, makes sets of training chopsticks, gives a freezy pop, etc. She loves him!  If you want a cheap, simple, quick meal with great service from a great guy, you cannot go wrong with Island Style.

Xwu0ex9NYfhGkZq9ziI4UQ.text: It is worth noting that they have expanded the floor space. They took the empty space next door and tore the wall down. It almost doubles the seating capacity. Even though it was still crazy busy when I went with my sister for lunch last week. Service was a bit lacking at first. It was 20min before we could flag one of the crew to get some water. After that though we were taken care of well.

sOxQnmznzeMzGYRzn4Fn3A.text: Love the new look of Island Syle! Love their cold noodle as always. The food taste even better than before. Don't forget to try Chinese food also. I strongly recommend to try ja-jang-myun with tang-su-yuk. Having a restaurant where u can have both Korean  and Korean-Chinese dishes are blessing. Family atmosphere and nice service. Try!!!

u51vgRqYcFS1yG7d0F_cBw.text: I'm an ex-pat: born and raised in Honolulu, graduated from UH, then moved to L.A. to find fame and fortune.  Didn't exactly find either, but married an L.A. girl, raised a family, had a decent career and am now enjoying life.  We vacation in Hawaii about every other year still, and as I'm an honorary Angeleno, my wife is an honorary Local.  So we like Hawaiian culture and lifestyle.  We visit Las Vegas at least once a year, and thanks to yelp, we found Island Style and made our first visit last week.  The yelpers were right on!  We liked the food and the Aloha Spirit epitomized by Russell and the young waiter who served us.  Besides tasting good, the food is comfort food for us.  We LOVED the boiled peanuts that came before our food.  As we explained to Russell, every time we return to Honolulu we immediately go to Times Market to buy a tray of boiled peanuts to nibble with our beers on the lanai.  Taste just like when I was a kid sitting in Honolulu Stadium watching the Islanders (yes, I'm old).  The good old days!  I won't go into a food review because other yelpers have done that. I'll just say that if you like Hawaiian-Asian food, da kine you would like to eat at home, dis is the place to find dat when you stay Vegas.  Maybe next time I'll get some boiled peanuts To Go and have Happy Hour out by the pool of my mega-hotel on The Strip, LOL.  Hmmmmm....

rX0j1t_hK_ZIcCdnKNLePQ.text: Was expecting more fusion dishes, ended up being just another Korean restaurant. Food is pretty good for Korean, but we came here specifically for the interesting element of Hawaiian + Korean. And we saw none of that on the menu.

m-n2ATzYXZAvZV9Ds5xiQQ.text: This place is my favorite cold noodle place :) I've been going this place for over 5 years..I know the owner and her family. foods are really good and prices are awesome! It is best to have cold noodle in  mostly summer but it is still good to have cold noodle in Winter too! I love their cold noodle and gal-bi. My other friends who wants to eat something else..they always get combination dishes..it is delicious too. Another thing about this place is the service is really great! Owner's husband is working at the Sahara location and owner is working at the Greenland location..they both are very friendly and try to give you the best service :) I love this place so much!! I really really love cold noodle so I tried everywhere in LasVegas but this place is the best!

opATp1ws-X3e4jyezUCCCw.text: Korean & Hawaiian deliciousness disguised as a hole in the wall.   Don't be too quick  to fall for all the fancy hip places my fellow fans of flavor. From Asian Pacific Islanders to East Coasters know that the best places to get your taste buds a fix is that the least suspecting places. This hole in the wall offers not just home run flavor Korean but also many Hawaiian favorites from Chicken Katsu to boiled peanuts. Me & my family have always been big Korean fans and finding a good place in Las Vegas has been hard for quite some time, but when we discovered Island Style we find ourselves stepping in their doors anytime we crave Korean food.    The Kalbi is excellent, but my favorite is the Meat Jun! They have plenty of tasty appetizers to pick from, large portions, reasonably prized, and the owners are so friendly! They are always either helping customers or working in the kitchen and their dedication has payed off! Everything I order here is consistently great, and the owners are so friendly they offer great help in making a good choice.    I have some Vegan & Vegetarian friends and as much as I love this place it probably wouldn't be my first choice seeing as how it's a largely meat based menu. Overall I back this place hard with 5 stars & if you're local and haven't tried you are missing the boat! Wether it's just you & a friend, or you & a family it's very accommodating and much more spacious than it looks. All this talk is making me crave some Boiled Peanuts & Chicken Katsu, I must fix this ASAP. Hope you enjoy your visit to Island Style!

ltHW7jVSdN3Jfylx9kzybg.text: Great food and great owner. outside looks not so good, but the food is great. cold dish is very good. the combo is the best. wish they serve beers.will come back.

IhmmvsMHsH4WHvEV_lElpw.text: Visited this placed based on yelp reviews.  Great service and food. Great banchan especially the korean seaweed.  Food came out hot and was excellent!  Flavor and portions were great! Will visit again....service was exceptional and everyone in the restaurant was very attentive,  which you don't get at many restaurants anymore!  A fav for me when I visit Vegas!  Will not disappoint. I ordered the bibimbap and curry chicken...no complaints!

p3tmNL-cddLBw0tpld8qyA.text: Great food, I loved it! I would stay away from the soups though. Overall it was great. A hidden gem for sure.

zrDaR8iw-TBM1mDnGqUFtw.text: Too bad I can't rate it more than five stars... da place deserves 10 stars, brah - it's that onolicious! After months of eating crappy food on Kwajalein it's like reaching an oasis of flavors! (I'm on vacation on the mainland from 'the rock' for a couple of weeks.)  A note to foodie snobs... this place may look more like a hole in the wall rather than a gourmet restaurant, but don't dis the place because of its appearance - you're missing out on some awesome food!  Took my brother along for lunch after we ran a couple of errands. After an appetizer of fried mandoo and the usual banchan I had the combo plate (meat jun, kalbi and BBQ chicken) and he went with the roast beef and gravy plate lunch. Neither one of us left anything on the plate when we finished. Yes, its that good!  Russell, the owner is a very friendly person choke full of the 'aloha spirit' and it rubs off on the wait staff as well. We didn't have to wait very long for our meals - I'd say it was already piping hot and on our table in less than ten minutes.  Definitely a must eat place in Sin City - and you got a customer for life! (Whenever I get some time off on parole from 'the rock'.)

AKOynMQcgvYCmpYtJvurXQ.text: when your gps leads you to an old strip mall parking lot, no need to double-check! it doesn't look like it, but you're really here! let your husband/boyfriend check it out while you wait in the car for his nod of approval as he stands at the partially opened restaurant door, and quickly make your way (but lock your car) to... great service and the best meat jun, korean bbq and hawaiian food in vegas!  our reward for a 4-hour drive to vegas is here for lunch with the family! on our drive back home to california, we have two pit-stops... gas station and here again! :)

GO597RhQHNe-nZIaCDLY0Q.text: Wow this place is super authentic!  It's located at an older strip mall. Parking then walking toward it, I was a bit skeptical. But once inside, lots of locals and you can tell is was legit. The food was great. Mandu, spam musubi were very freshly prepared. The tofu soup was a perfect amount of spice.  Service was good and it filled up around noon. Would definitely recommend this place.

GHXJtQON5dzn47SGGuL8uA.text: Amazing costumer service and food. I will recommend this place to everyone. If you don't try it you'll be missing out.

K3ZgqlMqxFGQUhApgMexQQ.text: Great local food! Im 20 & Ive been going here since I was 5/6 years old. Such a warm & loving environment to be in. The staff is great & so kind.

FEurhHpy0sonAPDpiKRWqQ.text: Great customer service! Our waitress was very friendly. The Kalbi is the bomb!! Not to mention the combo plate.

5EblcAnqz5o3GyGRy07eWA.text: This is our favorite restaurant for Korean food.  Prices are excellent especially when compared to other options for Korean.  We always get the spicy seafood soup very good and generous seafood portions.  Another favorite is the Stone Pot Bibimbop, perfect amount of flavor and excellent texture in the crunchy rice.  The side dishes are also amazing.  Service is always quick and friendly.  Decor leaves much to be desired, but we go for the food.  I highly recommend this restaurant.

NkZEm0gPqoyDYbRDsngMbA.text: My favorite go to spot whenever I am craving Hawaiian food or mool nyeung myun! Service is ALWAYS fast and friendly. Unlike other Hawaiian restaurants, they owners are always providing fresh, homemade banchaan (usually kim chee) that is always delicious!  I get the cold Korean buckwheat noodles whenever I come here during the summer. Nothing beats the savory, tart, spicey cold broth while slurping down chewy noodles! Definitely the best version I have found in  Vegas.

QcL1PqPhDEN79Gac7bFgnQ.text: This is a cool place to come especially if you love Hawaiian/Korean food. First you get boiled peanuts (which are very good) and Russell, the owner, is very generous with it. You also get hot Korean tea with your meal. Ordered the loco moco and got a nice sized hamburger patty on top of a huge mound of rice and topped with an egg and lots of gravy, Also had to try a side of Spam, which was grilled to perfection but a little too salty for me. The loco moco was just like the ones I had in Hawaii, though. The kimchi was great, especially the one that has been fermenting for a while, although it has a huge bite, so watch out when you are eating it. The regular kimchi was very good as were the pickled radishes. The staff makes you feel like you are in the islands with their laid back attitude and attentive service. Definitely recommend checking it out if you are in Las Vegas.

JJr-fevfyLtqZAl2Cf4ZRQ.text: Service is great. The server explained their dishes & didn't just assume we knew what everything was. The food was a little greasy but so good. They served 6 different apps that included pickled radishes, cabbage & boiled peanuts. We ordered the combo & spicy pork, both were delish & filled us up, (Mom, 15 & 5 year old).

IZbTVUvQFaMbVFD-goWc9g.text: Good service.  But this place is highly over rated and over priced.

FH8iUd0aRGEcYkSDipF7uQ.text: After a long drive to Vegas from the Bay Area, we were looking for a bite to eat before checking into our hotel. Instead of the usual expensive resort fare, we decided to duck into Island Style instead and have a light snack. Right.   Island Style is a very unassuming place in the middle of a nondescript strip mall on the west side. As plain looking as the place is, it is really about the food.
