m7NfN8cvwpnXtybQLe0cGg.text: This is the first time I've been to this hidden gem and I'm so glad I listened to the previous reviews.  Not only is the food delicious and served quickly, the restaurant itself is filled with a familial warmth and welcoming atmosphere.    The owner's truly make you feel at home, offering delicious suggestions of what to sample that night alongside sharing their favorite ways to enjoy the meal.  Tonight my husband and I tried the Black bean noodles & sweet sour pork combo alongside the beef bulgogi and spam fried rice.    Everything was delicious, choice side dishes (they serve an addictive clear seaweed salad that I loved)  and super refreshing iced barley tea...  Our favorite dish of the night was the Sweet and Sour Pork.  A must have!  We will be back again to try more of the menu.  Next time we'll be sure to bring friends as they have very generous portions!  Thank you for the delightful meal and allowing us into enjoy your company, we will be back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black Bean noodles, Sweet/Sour Pork, Bulgolgi, Spam fried rice, and a ton of yummy side dishes!

vDsrB7ZizbU1_gKsvq8ZMw.text: WOW! It's the only word I would best describe this place. From the outside, most people would just drive past it with even thinking about stopping in. There are no flashy sign, artsy decor, or anything that will grab your attention. One of our friend who is a regular and knows the owner invited us to check out this place.   This is definitely a hole in a wall establishment that built its reputation from making delicious food. You can tell the owner enjoyed what they do. They are constantly talking to the customers, taking orders, making recommendations, and checking on us periodically to make sure everything is okay. You don't get that at most places anymore.   We like to order a bit of everything and eat it family style. This let us try multiple dishes at once. To keep it from getting too long, everything we ordered was of top quality. Everything was delicious and flavorful. Some highlights are the mandu (Korean style dumpling), bi bim bop (hot stone), japchae, ja jang myeun with sweet and sour pork. They also have side dishes as well.   This is one place I will come back to try other dishes on their menu. We left feeling full and satisfied. The owners are super friendly and easy to talk to. They made our first time experience one we will not forget and possibly have future cravings for!

AaGag50xI4SR88k2aocB2Q.text: After so many years years this is still the only spot to even consider if you want home style Korean food just like omma used to make!   The food is delicious, the staff are friendly and hospitable. The barley tea hot or cold is refreshing. I love this place! You can't go wrong with the mandoo here. Their side dishes are very good as well. I like to ask for the whole fresh kimichi when they have it, it will change your life. The soondubu(tofu soup) is perfect here, as is their dolsot bibimbap(stone bowl) the trick with this one is to not stir the bottom until you are done so you get maximum crispy rice.   My favorite here is still the half and half with jjampong(spicy seafood noodle soup) and jajangmen(black bean noodle), or jajangbap(black bean sauce on rice). These are both the best that I've ever had and it is impossible to order just one. The good thing is. Island style doesn't make me choose, they have a split bowl so I can have a half order of each!  Anyways. This place is the best if you are looking for Korean food. I know there are a ton of Korean BBQ joints around, that's not what this place is. Island style is home style Korean food with some hawaiian flare done right. And the staff will treat you like family.

EWUtJR4F-iQ7JpEPGGSJPQ.text: This is the best home style Korean restaurant here in Vegas. Now there are a ton of Korean BBQ places in this city, but sometimes, you just want some Korean home cooking and not leave smelling like loads of grilled meat.   Must orders here are the stone pot bibimbap, and the seafood tofu stew. Recently we tried the oxtail soup and it was delicious. My boyfriend either orders the black bean sauce noodles or the spicy seafood noodle soup. But he loves both so much that they are usually gone before I can even get a taste of if.   The staff is super friendly and treat you like family. Make sure you get the barley tea, hot or cold they are great!

0JZwj9EdWbAYbr8Ju32PGw.text: My boss and I are both from Hawaii.  When he found out I had been living in Vegas for so long without trying Island Style, he made me go out to lunch with him "for research."  I must say that this the closest to genuine plate lunch that I've had in quite some time.  I'm not saying there aren't other awesome places but this place definitely brought me back to me childhood.   We got a lot of items (again, for research) and the highlights for me were the BBQ chicken and the meat jun.  Unfortunately, I didn't snap any pics (too hungry) but I know I'll be back because I need to bring my family here as well.

LxACvxPyCZZD5Y6V_qjYwg.text: This place feels like you're eating at your house.   Food: I ordered the haemul jam bong which came in a huge bowl with shrimp, mussels, clams, crab, ton of onions and other veggies. It's a soup noodle dish. The broth was delicious!!! It didn't taste "seafoody" at all. Just felt like a warm home cooked soup haha. Also got the sweet and sour pork which was nice! They put the sauce on the side so u can pour it yourself or dip :)  Their side dishes are also tasty. My favorite was this radish leaves kimchi (I think that's what I was told) but she brought it out a little later so not sure if it's part of the regular side dishes or if you have to ask for it.  They have both Korean and Hawaiian food on separate menus.   Service : they are so nice. All of the owners. They came out to fill our tea multiple times. They greeted us as soon as we walked through the door! And noticed one of my friends wearing a lighter color shirt and came over and offered one of those plastic bibs so he wouldn't get his shirt dirty.  When we were taking our noodles to go, after we packed em up they came over and taped everything so nothing spilled.   I would 10/10 recommend this place!!

xs3VBuXLONuP5Fmg0cJbDA.text: I don't think I've ever been to a Korean/Hawaiian fusion restaurant before so I didn't really know what to expect. The restaurant is spacious and has plenty of seating. As soon as we walked into the restaurant, we immediately felt welcomed. The service here was exceptional and the waitress even put on a bib for me because she didn't want me to stain my white shirt! I love the hospitality!   The banchan is standard here (kimchi, beansprouts, cold noodles, etc...) but I wish there was fish cake! Anyhow, I was in the mood for some hot tofu soup so I ordered the seafood soondubu. The broth was tasty and delicious. While there is a good amount of shrimp and mussels inside, I wish the egg that they drop inside the soup was a little more runny.  I wouldn't hesitate coming back to this place if I'm in town. I loved the service and felt so welcomed. I can't wait to explore more of their menu!

qR2Vej91ZgK1i02TE6DYyQ.text: WOW. I cannot believe I just been to this place just now. I used to pass by this place always telling myself I would try it one day.. literally for over a decade! I am so glad I decided to finally drop in today. I ordered the Kalbi & fried rice. OMG their fried rice portion is HUGE. Definitely enough to share! In my opinion, their Kalbi is the best that I've tasted compared to all the Hawaiian restaurants in town. Even better than Island Flavor's version. Customer service here is great. They are very friendly and so quick to serve you. The waitress gave us little plates of various items before our meals came out. The boiled peanuts were my favorite. It reminded me of the way my mom cooked hers when I was a little girl. The kind man recommended us the barley tea. I'm glad we got it. It was perfect even without sugar. I love this restaurant. I just hate the location. I only wish I had came and tried this place when I first saw it. The food here is legit and worth the long drive!

wHca8Oakwjf5_v92_iIw5Q.text: This is one of my favorite places to eat when I'm craving Korean food or local hawaiian fusion foods. I've eaten a lot of things on the menu but my favorite dishes are bi bim look soo, bi bim bop (hot stone pot is the best) and fried mandoo. It never fails that I always end up eating these items every time I go in. I even do a lot of take out from here. They're super fast and friendly. Service is never an issue for me here nor is the food. The place is a little older but I don't mind it. Makes me feel like I'm eating at a mom and pop shop or a bbq place back home in Hawaii. They usually give really good size portions too. I usually have food left over to take home as well. And they also give a lot of banchan even to go . Definitely would recommend anyone to try this place. Good food and good service is what will always bring me back.

nqGSLduG83XvgqgVA924bg.text: Wow. In terms of food, this is at least 4.5 stars. Shoot, maybe 4.7. But the location, decor, setting, and venue are just so "downtown" that it is distracting, and has to demerit a star. I'll be honest with you, Yelp Fam, I hesitated before going inside this restaurant.  I mean, I looked at the door, the sign, the parking lot, and then was going to turn back into my car.  But then I thought, "Hey, I'm a maverick! Plus, people on Yelp gave it high marks! Give it a try!"  So I did.  And it was worth it.  The food almost makes up for the lack of ambience, decor, or any style of any sort.  The set up is like a dank cafeteria in a work camp in 1950s Poland, or Korea, perhaps.  The restaurant is clean, don't get me wrong.  Just not sparkly or bright.  The art on the wall, such as it is, is an afterthought, and there is a lone TV playing some completely nondescript channel.  Tables are pushed together "family style," but it does not feel like your family.  But the food is top notch.  And the hospitality and service are even better.  The little fried fish, something like a large sardine, was as perfect a bite as I have had in a long while.  Smoky, with just the right amount of salt and texture.  The little antipasti, seaweed, kimchi, and even little cut up hot dogs, were delightful, with interesting clashing of flavor, and just the right amount of heat.  The pork belly soup was strong, generously filled with vegetables and tofu. (I could have used a little more pork belly, but that is being picky).  The beef rib bim bip bop (spelling?) was rich and succulent, with pickled carrots and seaweed that should not have worked together, but did.    Everything came out hot, quick, and with a sincere smile.  Things were cleared away at the right time, and you were checked on just when you needed to be without hovering.  Really expert.  The server was extremely adept at making you feel welcome and helping you to understand and order what you wanted off the vast menu.  She was a doll, and a consummate professional who could likely fit in at any Michelin star restaurant (and I've been to a couple!)    I have since learned that the style of dining is depicted on various Korean soap opera dramas, so not that unusual.  It is encouraging that people do come with their families here, and you can hear some diners speaking in Korean.  (Although the restaurant presents a pan-Asian menu, with Hawaiian specialties).  I think the restaurant would only need a little makeover help to make this place a more attractive eatery (after all, we do "eat" with our "eyes," as well).  If you don't mind the atmosphere, you will enjoy a great meal and hospitality here.

3yMpsoCH6kcA-7Al4hUeuA.text: Wow! There's a reason why I love eating off The Strip. First of all I wanna say that when you walk into this restaurant you'll be treated like family. I felt like I was eating at my parents house. You're greeted and treated so warmly here.  The food here is delicious. It's Hawaiian and Korean. You have your Hawaiian dishes (spam musubi, moco loco, etc) and then you have your Korean dishes. You get good banchan while you wait (boiled peanuts, kimchi, radish etc). I got the bibimbap on a hot stone and it was so delicious. The size of the dish is pretty big and the price is just right. If you're not too hungry you might want to consider sharing with a friend.   Overall the strip mall and the parking lot are a bit sketchy and odd, and the layout of the restaurant is very basic. But, don't think twice about the looks cuz this place is amazing.

xH4oKb1sK8DBIjxzTWZP_g.text: Great food and service.  Everyone is friendly and inviting! I was surprised that there was more Korean food than Hawaiian, but I didn't mind.  The banchan was delicious too!! I was kind of thrown off by the exterior as it is in kind of a shady area, but I definitely will be back again and again!!

Ia2XAxczCI8myzGhCdFMcA.text: Very courteous staff and very engaging. The food was amazing. Highly recommend trying out the hot bowl bibimbap.

My 6 yr old daughter couldn't finish and hd to leave because of the staff's annoying conversation to pressure us out. Totally unpleasant experience. Never again!

nz1OTnxB1SHRuetHd8Odvg.text: This is a nice little place. I've been here a few times, all the food is very good. I love all the little korean side dishes.  The hawaiian juices are very yummy too. You gotta check this place out.

lSxvUrIigIpfZcrYA8rWUw.text: Everything here is delicious but especially their homemade dumplings(either deep fried or pan fried). We often get the kalbi and cold noodles combo. The staff is super nice and helpful, and all my favorite foods have come from their suggestions. I have never seen this place not full, so you know it's delicious.

mY029vgayTId4bT_feMNcw.text: Good food--simple, affordable and delicious!  Had the combo plate with brown rice and mac salad.  Good sized portions, and the service was friendly.  Kimchi and boiled peanuts were yummy!

vrX5ugHtNHJgDtbasdLxwA.text: For as much as I rant about how much I love Korean food, I am the first to admit that I haven't a clue about it. I mean, honestly, I've only tried a handful of Korean dishes, and probably couldn't tell you much about them other than a brief description. But I stick to what I love and know best: meat and noodles.  My brother and I met Katrina M. here for a lunch date - welcomed warmly on such a dreary day. We ordered the Meat Combo plate ($9.90) that came with Meat Jun, BBQ Chicken, Kalbi, macaroni salad and rice. Then, of course, we ordered my spicy cold noodles ($9.90) and a sauntering pot of seafood soup for Katrina M.   I was pleasantly surprised that I enjoyed all the meat options - the Meat Jun unexpectedly becoming my favorite. Egg battered beef, it was tender and bursting with flavor. The chicken was moist and flavorful, and kalbi is always good. But my cold buckwheat noodles - they were perfection. The balance of spice and acidity warming me up perfectly on a "Seattle" day.  What really made this trip to Island Style was the hospitality. Warmly greeted by both the proprietor and his never-ending supply of hot barley tea, I felt like I could sit there forever, taking shelter from the sporadic weather, eating my spicy noodles in bliss.

I8NQRE7AXMuHlKrxm8vuBg.text: Love Russell's personal attention.  Fanstatic food at very cheap prices. If you leave here hungry, something is wrong with you.  Thank you again Yelp for helping us choose a great place. Another great hole in the wall

ToArG-IvCI8fsrpPKPCdQg.text: seems to be family run business a little while off the main strip. owners (I believe?) were very giving; we witnessed them giving a homeless lady some food and cash, they refilled our banchan a few times, and packed some extra for us with our take-out order. we ordered 4 dishes: saimin, chicken curry and spam/eggs and rice and loco moco, total $57 w tax and tip. $2 more for brown rice. portions were ok for the price, $11-$13 per plate. taste was good and hit the spot for my hubby, kids and myself.

5ejUCU-9YbGwmSSPCeeVeA.text: Really good tasting food.   Very unique. .. first time a Korean with Hawaiian and Chinese combo.  Had the cold noodle and kalbi ... made well. .. authentic.   Will go back again.

t_s3RnltHcqrP32f2ltm1A.text: This place is awesome! I just wish it wasn't so far away from where i live. Taste just like home (Hawaii) and they give portions like home too! (Very hard to find here-w/quality). They also serve you a variety of side dishes including: kimchi, cucumbers, bean sprouts, etc. Their service is fast and friendly! Very laxed atmosphere too.

vNXuv9lHeNlZEfHv9vJm2g.text: Service is awesome the server Russell is the best. Always tending to tables and making sure everyone is ok and their sides are refilled I give them ten thumbs up.

6owWcrmKKtfsF24NO1geKg.text: Awesome food and great prices!  Yelp is wrong about time...Monday-Saturday 11-9. Awesome condiments with fish cake and cucumber, my GF favorite.  I like the hospitality of the owner, Russell.

zDxaNA62tJ5sN1P0fjwPfA.text: I came here wanting some kalua pig. It was OK, I think Aloha kitchen is better. The cabbage was not cooked and it had vinegar on it which was funny tasting with the kalua.

rfxWrJLNdmTyUZdUsWZ6hg.text: Another outstanding meal at Island Style.  This remains one of my favorite restaurants in all of Las Vegas.  Russell and his wife are always so welcoming, and the food is always fast, hot, delicious and plentiful.  They never let our glasses get half empty or our stomachs to go without some gratifying morsel.  They are always going above and beyond, like bringing us extra mandu or topping off my kids' meal with an Otter Pop!  This place is a gem, and it deserves so much to be on map of great restaurants, but yet I want it to remain small and intimate and familial like it is.  My family and I want to yell it from the rooftops--- WE LOVE THIS PLACE!

EHEg-d0iBQ1xRj85hc_Ppg.text: My first time there at your restaurant.   I ordered combo plate, my so had the Kalbi plate and chicken kat sure Spent o about $55.00.  Food tasted good but the portion was not worth the price.  $19.99 for kalbi but the Korean kalbi small and skinny, the combo was $15.00 but 1 piece meat each was not worth the pruce, the chicken kat su like 1 piece chicken breastfeeding cut into 6 pieces.  Which was $10.00.  Portion servings is not worth the price you charge.  I really think you guys should reconsider your servings.  I am a chef myself and feel that the prices is not worth it.  If you tried 808 mixed plate kalbi it's the fat kalbi with lots of meet on and grilled beautiful and almost same price very tasty.  Even L & L GIVES HALF A PLATE OF KATSU AND SAME PRICE.   Thank you

ma7cv6TwCJYjexPpoBWKkw.text: Awesome everything!!  Service, food, friendliness, never misses!  Gotta come back to try the new menu!

tjqwHxawRSIKE71-80J3fw.text: Great home-style Korean food.  Also appreciate the option of jjajangmyun now, too.  Good food at decent prices with huge portions.  The banchan are plentiful, and they're always happy to give more on request.  Mandu is hand-made and not the yucky frozen stuff.

QuRKALx6iKXOA-S8JmiGsA.text: Whenever people go to Vegas people tend to stay on the strip and go to the touristy hot spots, but when I went to Vegas this past weekend I wanted to venture to eat at places that was off the strip. Some of my friends have been here previously and told me how amazing the food was and how nice the owners are.   So a big group of my friends and I went here for lunch. I got:  -combination plate: the beef jun is sooo sooo good.  -fried mondu: very fresh and light tasting  -spam msubui: I love spam and its prepared fresh and made with a little bit of sauce in it  -Kimchee and pickled radish: its so fresh and yummy. I couldn't stop eating it!   Everything on the menu looks so good. It was really hard for my friends and I to make a deciosn of what to get. The owners are so nice here. I will make sure to stop by this place every time I am in Vegas. Food was really good and you can tell all the locals love going to this place. One of my favorite meals in Vegas!

4XqaTHwzihnyMTscYmRA4w.text: LOVED this place! Great authentic Korean dishes and wonderfully polite staff. May not look like much on the outside but don't judge this book by its cover! YUMMMM!

8SuL5hGLw0Bftf5MYqrr9g.text: Korean Chinese restaurant. Had 4 to 5 people combo. Jjajang Myun was good. Khan pooing shrimp was good. Tang Soo yuk was also pretty delicious. I would recommend if u r craving Korean chinese in Las Vegas for sure

Z6A-g8o-z4876LIm-FLepw.text: Best and most authentic Korea food ever!!! I'm from New York and I wish wish wish this place was in NY. This was the closest authentic Korean food I've had compared to the food I had in Korea!

AUCZ7QQubhvtc6FzK5dZNA.text: Excellent food fast service. The table odered a variety of things from the Bulgogi to Seafood t and i had the hot stone Bi Bim Bop, its outstanding. The fresh Korean veggies were very good as well. Looking forward to coming back to try other dishes on my next trip.

bjk6Zf8a-s4ky-6zOROvtw.text: Mannnnn have I missed me some island Korean BBQ. I moved to Vegas in May and have had a craving for it. Cravings that which were satisfied today. Tastes just like Tasty Korean BBQ in Waipahu or Dong Yang out it Wahiawa. Servings were just like home too. Nice and plentiful. Oh, and did I mention the fried noodles?!? YASSSSSSS! SjLzLC3Oq79WKVU39Dw0Iw.text: We've been coming here for years.  From the first visit they've treated us with great service, very friendly.  They have awesome Korean dishes with generous sides.  They recently renovated and expanded the restaurant to hold more patrons.  If you love Korean food, this place is a must.  It's also a family owned business, and they take pride in what they do. PZCS6UMONOTzhWF_XEbnpA.text: I've never completed a yelp review before, however, I was compelled to do a review for Island Style after my experience there today.  Condition: Don't let the location of a ghetto strip mall & exterior "hole-in-the-wall" appearance fool you. The restaurant is very clean and well-kept. Even the chopsticks are nicer than most restaurants in Vegas  Service: A+++ Upon entering the restaurant, we were greeted by Russell right away. Before i could even put my bag down he came by with free boiled peanuts, water and menu recommendations for us. Guess we looked like newbies :P Russell also made sure our water and tea glasses were never empty and kept refilling our side dishes without even being asked. He is definitely not stingy about his food like most Asian restaurants. We weren't treated as customers, but more like family  Food: A+++          - I got the Seafood Soondubu + Kalbi + Fish = A+++ Tasty tofu soup with clams, mushroom & shrimp. The kalbi and fish were good, but nothing extraordinary.             - My BF and GF got the Combo with Meat Jun, chicken & Kalbi with substituted    fried rice. DELICIOUS! Not to mention, the portions were pretty big, which just means i get to share with them :P  Complimentary Side dishes: A+++ radish, cabbage kimchee, bean sprouts, & Hot dog with onions. My favorite was the cabbage kimchee --i could eat those like chips!!! The hot dog and bean sprouts were also yummy. Russell also brought us some dried seaweed and "korean style" kimchee to try out; that one was too sour for me.  I am definitely coming back the next chance i get! I love Russell's enthusiasm and charismatic personality! How he runs his restaurant is refreshing and rare in this town. My BF even said he felt like Russell was like an Uncle to him LOL  TIP: Don't confuse this restaurant with the one on spring mountain, with almost the same name!

hagPDZmwUvnMcJzQqV_Uqg.text: It's quite difficult finding meat jun in las Vegas. At Island Favorites, not only do they serve the most ono meat jun but they also have the vast assortment of, well.... island favorites!  I was so excited when we discovered this hidden gem on urban spoon and yelp, that my husband and I drove down right away!  It did not disappoint either...many of the other reviews talked about it being a hole in the wall or a non attractive restaurant but on the contrary it is much nicer than many of the Korean restaurants in Hawaii. The atmosphere is quaint and slightly reminiscent of many local Hawaii establishments.  The menu had everything I wanted and the service was absolutely terrific!! My husband and I ordered the combo plates and were very pleased by the portions and price.  Overall a top notch place with excellent food, service, and experience. You definitely receive Aloha treatment here and I would recommend it to anyone!

voNW_g7mij_ihNHC6bB8nA.text: This is the best restaurant I have been to in Vegas hands down. The food is great, and the service is even more phenomenal. Also, where else can you get korean AND hawaiian food?? If you're debating between a couple places, this is the one to choose.   On the recommendation of the owner, we ordered the manju (dumplings) fried, the combo plate with teriyaki chicken, kalbi, and meat jun (marinated meat topped with egg), and the fried saipan. The dumplings were really good...juicy on the inside and crisp on the outside with a delicious sauce to dip in. The combo plate came with macaroni salad and we added the spam fried rice to it (definitely do it). All of the meats on the combo plate were tasty and I'd highly recommend it to anyone wanting to try a lot of different items on the menu. The fried saipan was good, but I would probably try something else when I come back since it didn't blow me away. Along with the meal, there's a couple banchan (side dishes), which were pickled daichon, kimchi, and fried hot dog pieces. All of these were well made as well.  In terms of the service, it was as if I was at my aunt or grandma's house... we were hooked up with an extra dumpling on the manju plate to make sure that each person had an equal number of dumplings at our table. When our water ran out, we were given bottled water at no charge. Also, our Hawaiian Sun drink was on the house. The owner also gave us a sample of the saipan noodle soup, which was delicious and contained no oil whatsover, a rarity these days. At the end of the meal, we were given hot tea on the house as well in to-go cups. Can't say enough about the treatment of customers here. Amazing.

-gSp9O8U40sOi6_loQecCQ.text: There was three of us who came and tried this restaurant, we all love korean food so our expectation is pretty high, especially after reading yelp reviews...this place did not disappoint...the location is not the most attractive place in vegas and most visitors will never try coming to this local gem, but if you are like me who is looking at las vegas as a vacation resort instead of just gambling and party destination, then you will love mingling with the locals here...the ambience is great, service is good amd most of the guest are very relax...the decor is nothing to be proud of and the location is caterred to locals, but you will not leave disappointed...start with their combo...share your orders so you can try more of their menu...if you are with group, try not to order the same item and just share...

Ea3JkarlLx4HkEx-f7NjoA.text: The hours of operation on their yelp page has changed from 10:30 to 11:00, I found out the hard way when I had to sit on the parking lot for an extra 30 min.  Also I was scrolling through some pics and the prices on the menu especially on the breakfast list has gotten changed to a dollar more on some of their food items.  Other than that service was great, but personally I thought the food was mediocre.     I took the liberty of trying their breakfast menu since I'm a sucker for the loco moco but I felt that it wasn't on par with others that I've tried elsewhere in the city.  I got my bf the Portuguese sausage with eggs and it wasn't anything special either.    However, I don't plan in counting them out just yet, I will probably be back to try their Korean side of the menu to fully decide whether or not I will be a regular.

CanKGcFpVTW3RNDx-QoEcA.text: Tons of banchan and barley tea right off the bat! One of the banchan plates (angel noodle salad), I'd never had before, which was fun to try.  The japchae was the perfect texture, and meat jun really lived up to the hype. We decided to mix and match pork and squid for their spicy bulgogi combo, which in retrospect was a weird pairing. All of the portions were huge! Even though we were splitting among three very hungry young people, we had tons of leftovers. The meat jun combo alone comes with 3 full size servings of meat (teriyaki chicken, egg fried beef, and short ribs) and rice and sauce and macaroni salad.  Overall: fast service, tasty food, and a really nice casual family vibe. I'd definitely come back!

8_QRwkFCMWtD6zVlhj5y0g.text: The food was pretty good, but come armed with lots of patience, because they are very slow to fill your order. The price was right and one full star goes to the cute friendly waiter that gave us a hug, Cheers!

nXwgIoBohBeMV73-cHSKrw.text: This place was great!we ordered thukk gook for my son, youkeaejang for me and orange chicken to share,everything was delicious! Service was great n friendly. When we come to Vegas again we will be back

ftNzJR5unB-wsOKi4SiC8A.text: Five stars just for the friendly staff.  You feel Ohana when you open the door.  Authentic Hawaiian food from the POG to the 2 scoop white rice and one mac salad.  Had the Kaulua and Cabbage, so yum. The poke with sesame was superb!!! Husband had the Kaulua BBQ sandwich on Hawaiian roll.  The portions were enormous and we had to bring some home. Am looking forward to trying the desserts next time.  Brought home  a Spam Musubi for Breakfast.  Mahalo for the taste memories!!!!

_elqenW-X69bHdizLh3BLA.text: Every time I go Las Vegas, I would have to stopped by here at least once! The food here is great and amazing. This place has one of the best Ox tail soup I ever had. No regrets!

c2EFRVevzQkCdZz4JPphbw.text: The meat jun is the best in town.  I especially like the meat Jun sauce and the Kim Chi. Russell is a very gracious server and gives generous  food portions. I only wish they would open more  locations here in town.

3Mr10u_ZWDC_R6JJJkZl2A.text: Great Korean and Hawaiian food for a reasonable price. It has a hole in the wall atmosphere when communal seating.  I can't say that I've had a bad meal there!

GGCKFKJMUWpVIQX7oPcApQ.text: I've been coming to this restaurant for 8 years! Born & raised in Hawaii you miss the food so of course this is the place to come too when you need your fix would absolutely recommend this place if your from the islands & missing home.

XIQCVbeJ0zGomHOXO-ktBg.text: Love this place all around. Somewhere you can bring the kids or lunch with co workers. All staff is extremely friendly and always bring out items to try and not charge. Before you order, they bring out 5-6 special appetizers to munch on before your meal arrives. It's a family ran business, I didn't realize till about the 4th time that the owners serve the customers directly. Food is amazing and very authentic. Favorite is the hot stone bowl and seafood soup

fj1D9F_GX2QOOTRZpO1tbA.text: I love this place! The spicy soup is delicious!

n1-dz67Io2StxTnXP9mcEw.text: AMAZING! Island Style is a gem. Not only is the food always delicious...but the customer service is soooo fabulous. Russell, his wife, YoungHee...they are sooo personable and really make you feel at home. We would go at least three times a week if we lived closer. If I'm anywhere near, I will call ahead and order takeout for my family. Dolsat bibimbap is our all-time favorite, meat jun, fish jun, jajangmyun, naengmyun (in the summer), the boiled peanut appetizers, steamed mandu...YUMMMMM!

ya3iFCamuGi8ekBWiVJyNA.text: I started off with a disappointing experience at another Hawaiian joint and after losing my appetite I was determine to try a new place and put a fix to my Hawaiian craving. Island Style was easy to find, there was plenty of parking, the outside looked kinda scary but I wasn't going to let that stop me from my new culinary adventure. Inside was full of tables to pick from that later on became occupied. The server which I think was the owner was super nice and greeted as very quickly with water and a bowl of boiled peanuts. I'm allergic but I tried the peanuts, they were tasty and salty.   The menu was sorta divided with Hawaiian/Korean dishes. I ordered some crunchy mandu to start with; they are meat filled half shaped moon dumplings that resemble Japanese gioza, they were very flavorful. Our server arrived with four Korean side dishes of unexpected banchan. The banchan included kimchi, radish cubes kimchi style, mung bean sprouts, and vienna sausages. I decided to order the famous bulgogi which I haven't had in more than 4 years since my last trip to Korea. The bulgogi was right on point just like I've had it in the past but smothered in onions which I just pushed to the side. I also got to try the katsu chicken, it was so good and crunchy, I didn't care too much for the sauce but it was decent. Both entrees came with a side of rice and macaroni salad.   This place was way tastier than Island Flavor, their macaroni salad was to die for, it wasn't bland at all. Our server came to check on us and asked us if we wanted refills on the banchan! Anywhere else they charge you but not this awesome joint. We were even offered hot tea but it was kinda warm inside so we skipped it. I can defenately keep coming back to this place. I want to try the musubi and kalbi ribs next time.

EPBM9QCxRTn6tKnoXf1uoA.text: Absolutely delicious! I am so impressed with this little whole in the wall joint. Parking was very easy, and we were seated right away. I ended up ordering the spicy chicken, Korean style. It was literally AMAZING! It came with a generous side of white rice and Hawaiian style mac salad. And of course, some Korean appetizers, they were all soooo good! My boyfriend got the same thing I did, but with pork and his was fantastic as well. I believe it was $11.95, and honestly for that price and the amount of food you can't beat it! I will definitely be stopping here next time I'm in town.

ZNgXbwbxXjeDq1dbSZouBg.text: I heard about this place thru a friend. I am a HUGE meat-jun fanatic and I try to get it as much as I can. So when I heard this place has good meat-jun I had to try it. Food is great and service as well. I love all of the little side dishes that come with plates. The various types of kimchee is awesome. I especially liked the turnip kimchee and kelp noodles. Looking forward to coming back!

3TP4rKo1V6vVUG4Pi8hD-A.text: A bit hidden but well worth a shot, the service is first rate, add some tasty food to the mix and this place is a winner. Not being very adventurous I stuck with the Teriyaki Chicken while the wife had the Bulgogi, both were excellent. Mixed with an array of sampler items made for a very interesting meal even for the unadventurous diner such as myself. If you're in the area don't pass this restaurant up you will be pleasantly surprised.

O2Vsk5Qd_anahEqezwogOQ.text: The original owners Ivan (R.I.P) and Grace have been serving up some of the best home cooked Hawaiian/Korean food from this mini-strip mall on Sahara since the 90's. Ivan was truly one of the nicest people you'll ever meet! Always a good story about his childhood and he just love seeing his customers faces as they enjoyed the Ono dishes he would whip up! While Grace has since remarried, the place is still as good as I remember from back then!  She and her new husband have done an awesome job on preserving what made Island Style famous! Meat Jun and the delicious Kalbi are just some of the good eats you'll find at this place. The customer service, the ambiance and the food will just grow on you to the point that it will be a must eat spot every time you come and visit!

bArz387Pf8JR03iyI7UeCw.text: I wish I could give this place 10 stars!!! Me and 3 friends ventured out to Vegas for the weekend and since were all from Hawaii we decided to go on an adventure to seek out some island food.  THANK GOODNESS we found ISLAND STYLE! The second we walked into the door, the server put down boiled peanuts, BOILED PEANUTS!  I was sold from then on.  (my dad and I would always get boiled peanuts on our fishing trips..nostalgic moment). But the he continues to bring out kim chee, pickled daikon, hot dogs, bean sprouts, the works!  We almost started to get sad because it reminded us of home so much. So then we ordered some spam musubis, meat jun, chicken katsu, and ribs.  All of it was AMAZING.  The owner was such a sweet and genuine guy.  Needless to say, every time I venture to Vegas I will be stopping into this establishment.  Genuine people, amazing home cooking, what more could you ask for?  I never would have expected this place to be one of the best restaurant experiences I've had in a while.

ez9JsxKKOM51g54B7to0gg.text: By far the best Bulgogi and Mandu I have ever eaten. The Kimchee is excellent and ask for the daikon radish type, it is to die for!  Russel, the owner, never forgets a face and is the coolest guy ever. We have NEVER had a bad meal here!

iskrVAHhl5N-Ff8oF1rVlQ.text: First of all, get over yourself.  Its a a nice "hole-in-the-wall",  well off the strip.  Get past that and you'll have some amazing food. Not only do you get amazing, homemade style korean/hawaiian food you get a family run restaurant and it shows.  The mom, pop, and son hospitality is second to none. For $18 i got a full delicious meal and I felt like mom was watching over me. Leave the pretentiousness and chips back at the strip, take a taxi or car to the strip mall that houses Island Style and have some great food instead of the usual factory buffets.

MUx7VN2bErPt7y6cLaWPnQ.text: I don't particularly care for much Hawaiian food, it's a little heavy on the Spam for my taste, but Island Style on Sahara does the cuisine justice and serves it with as much hospitality as their friends across the Pacific. Better still, only one item on the menu is over $10 and you are generously showered with large portions of free appetizers.  We were given addictive boiled peanuts and kimchee, as well as pickled bean sprouts, cucumbers, and radishes, all before we even ordered. The peanuts were the highlight, with the shells enveloping the salty brine they were cooked in so you could enjoy it with your legume. Did I mention they were free?  As you may have surmised from the appetizers, Island Style serves "Fusion Korean Food and Island Style Loco Food." Though you may recognize most menu items, many will probably provide you with a learning experience, as they did for me. Don't worry, your uber friendly host will explain each item with big picture menus and photos on the wall so you aren't at a loss for what to order.  I passed on my favorite Korean dish, Bi Bim Bap, in favor of the Hot Spicy Beef soup ($9.90). This was served in a massive bowl filled to the brim with shredded beef, glass noodles, mushrooms, scallions, and egg simmered in a paprika broth (think Korean goulash). It was hot and spicy for sure, but not overwhelmingly so, and it kept growing on me sip after sip. Ian ordered the Meat Jun ($8.25), which we both agreed was even better. This dish consists of pounded beef marinated in a sweet and salty shoyu (soy) sauce, that is then coated in egg and pan fried (think paillard francese). It is served with rice, bland macaroni salad (a Hawaiian staple), and more of the incredible shoyu sauce. If you eat meat, get this.  We were honestly shocked by how good the food was as it was better than anything we had in Hawaii and there were actually some healthy items as well. The server, who I believe was the owner, couldn't have been more genuine, friendly, and competent. Even if the food wasn't good, we still might have gone back anyway just because of his hospitality. If you want to explore Hawaiian cuisine in Vegas, this is definitely the place to do it

UVwh_gEC-nm1ELz2auLjaA.text: Walked in and stood there for 10mins while every person that walked in behind me who was Asian was served first. Finally sat down and still got no service. Had to walk out. Not authentic Hawaiian. This is an Asian restaurant serving Hawaiian dishes. Horrible service!

YACGetIpwIoO3ESNDNIEYA.text: This place has received plenty of positive reviews on YELP. I am not sure why.  I only came here for lunch because Ko-Mex was closed yesterday. From the outside, the place looks sketchy. However, I was pleasantly surprised at the clean and inviting dining area once we walked in the door.   For lunch, I chose the Moco-Loco which was layered with steamed rice, a hamburger patty, a fried egg, and brown gravy. I asked for my egg scrambled, not fried. Oh well - I ate it anyways. The dish was good--not great.   My wife tried the Korean noodle dish-Japchae. We didn't like the texture of the noodles they used for this dish. Imagine the texture of gummi bears while eating noodles. Because they were so spongy, no flavor stuck to them. Who wants to eat plain spongy noodles? Not this guy....  My parents were with us since they were visiting from the Bay Area. They both chose the bibimbap (spelling?) which was a bowl of rice, vegetables, beef, an egg, and spices. The beef inside these bowls was bland, tough, and fatty. Oh, and the side of macaroni salad was way too salty.  The service was spotty. For example, I didn't like that our entrees were coming out one at a time -every 5 minutes.  Plus, I was not offered a drink refill at all during lunch.  The more I write this review, the more I realize I don't really like anything about this place.

zjCV2CYMWRTBMyCBqU2l3w.text: Absolutely love this place I live right near it for 4 yrs never seen it till today . great service, I love how they speak Korean . server was super nice . I ordered the hot stone pot bi bim bap . ive never had it so the sever came over showed me how to mix and what to put in it . the kalbi was soft and delicious I had no idea that the mang chun was gonna be one of my faves . the jajang was the best I've ever had taste so different than the others . this place was a hidden gem deff. Coming again .

osuw9H3L604ecHmqfswV6w.text: I am always on the lookout for authentic food. Island Style never disappoints. I am a big fan of the hotpot bipimbop.(sp?) We tried the meat jun tonight it reminded me of matzo brie. :-) the servers are all super attentive and sweet. The owner Gina is always smiling and makes you feel at home.
