sTLhtId2bPgUCawpuDuN7w.text: Food here is the best I normally get the spicy squid and pork combo but ive been here A LOT n ive tried a bunch of stuff  even the breakfast options is off the hook  Uncle russell is always with open arms to my family and I, thank you for the wonderful hospitality!  i wish only good luck and growth in this company.We need you around!!

CXEwtq0t7c9n_LQW-9R0eQ.text: Excellent food and great service ! ALWAYS recommend them ! Family owned and they care about their food and their customers !  Great bonchon and boiled peanuts ! Authentic Korean dishes - lots of Hawaiian Island type of BBQ favorites.  Two great locations - Sahara and Valley view plus they are located in the Koreatown Shopping Center.

6mhBLI3F-x51IgoRkGtFFw.text: Updating just because I finally got to try their Kalbi ribs : yelp.com/biz_photos/isla... Yes, they are amazing. Super tender, perfectly cooked (nice crispy edges, but juicy meat). Very very good...easily the best I have had so far. I really like the bulgogi here too : yelp.com/biz_photos/isla... For the same reasons...it is very tender, perfectly cooked with the crispy edges and juicy meat. The veggies soak up all that flavor and I find myself eating most of them! Handmade Pork Mandu (won tons) : yelp.com/biz_photos/isla... Very yummy, especially with the sauce :) And of course, you always get an assortment of banchan here! yelp.com/biz_photos/isla... Lots of goodies, and they always offer to refill, so don't be shy! Also tried a fish dish...sorry, don't remember the name, but it was a full fish on the bone.....Cooked perfectly and had plenty of flavor. Of course, the service is one of the best you will find in Vegas. It is cliche, but you WILL feel like you are family here. I love coming here...one of my favorite spots in town hands down!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banchan!
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Handmade Pork Mandu (won tons)...very yummy, especially with the sauce :)
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi! Probably my most favorite Korean dish, and they do it well here!

dqFt-py0sDbpi21Ob2dGUQ.text: Always great food and service. We love the home made noodles and gyoza. We also cant resist not getting the combo. The consistency of taste, texture and flavor always stay the same eveytime we eat here. Love love this place.

C0Ts2bp6rJozab6FxO8UZg.text: This was an unexpected surprise!  Island style is a restaurant a couple miles off of the strip that looks kind of run down from the outside, and not much to look at from the inside either. I was brought here to try food that was Hawaiian, but also Korean  ...huh?!?    Regardless of what type of food it was, it was super tasty!  I ordered the teriyaki beef plate.  It came with rice and macaroni salad.  The beef and the macaroni had great flavor.  The rice was rice, and tasted like rice should.  The curveball was that they served Korean style vegetable side dishes, like kimchi, to go along with the food.  They were okay, but the real highlight was the main entree.  I am still salivating over how delicious the beef was, and I can't wait to have it again.    Island Style is not the type of place to take someone who is vacationing in Vegas if you want to impress them...unless they really like flavorful food! Thankfully I do! It was an awesome find, and a great new place for me to go whenever I want to venture off of the strip.

bG7CDox-VdkaPIWSMo0DJg.text: The first couple times I want to this place it was kind of small but they've since expanded. Regardless the food has always been good and the service spectacular. Every time I come here the owner makes us feel like family. His attitude is always up beat. The food is flavorful and generous in portion. The array of things that bring to your table, such as peanuts and kimchi, are more than enough as an appetizer. When I had the beef katsu this last time our server gave me new sauces to try, one he makes in house and a new one that they just ordered. At the end of our meal he came and gave us some ice pops. Definitely felt like I was at my uncles house for a family dinner. No matter what I order here I'm always pleased and leaving full.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Feeling like happy kids with the ice pops they gave us after our meal.
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef katsu
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7dbQElg09EqrBIw_w5cnIg.text: How could I forget about this place? Recently I had a serious craving for meat Jun after a fellow yelper posted her delicious plate on Instagram and I remembered how much I loved this place! We have been coming here for years and they never fail. Whenever we want good island food or quick Korean food this is a good place to come. They have delicious loco moco, hamburger steak, bibimbap, and my favorite Korean meat Jun. Meat Jun is basically tender beef dipped in egg pan fried and served with a soy dipping sauce. In Hawaii you can find it on any menu but in Vegas it's hard to find. I love the fact that they serve banchan with all the menu items because I'm obsessed with banchan and Korean food in general. This place has expanded since my last visit which has been quite a while but they are busier than I remember them being before. Regardless of all that when your craving island style Hawaiian Iran food this place doesn't disappoint. Just a tip you might have to park next door in the eyeglass parking lot and walk over as this shopping lot gets busy and rarely has parking.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat Jun! More meat hiding underneath you&#39;ll have plenty of leftovers with anything you order.
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banchan!

lOYlSDEzoyRknWIutggoIQ.text: Amazing customer service. I love the friendly waiter guy with the nose piercing!!  Staff: 5 stars! He is such a smiley person! He gave us more rice when my cousin wanted some after squirting waaay too much sauce into her bibimbap. He led us to the bathrooms. He basically solved all our problems one by one, all with a smile! Great experience after a hard night going HAM in Vegas.   Food: 5 stars! Great Soondobu that really hit the spot. It's not THE BEST I've ever had, but it was great. The guys got the meat platters and that was great too. Bibimbap was great too. Very large portions so they're very filling! I recommend them all. Prices were great too!  I would definitely come here again :) Recommended small mom and pop feel shop!

N8-z7xEYpg4WVMzYbBX4Lw.text: I came here last week after going all over town running errands....by the time I arrived at Island Style I was starving! I'm glad the owner brought over the radishes and kimchee while I waited for my Kalbi combo. I usually like to eat them with my rice but I needed to snack on something quick!  They were really good it had just the right amount of spice in it.   The Kalbi combo came with macaroni salad and white rice. The portions are pretty big so I ended up taking half of it home. The Kalbi was nice and tender and the mac salad was tasty. I also liked the fact they served regular hamburgers so my husband can eat something that is familiar to him. When I usually take him to Asian places to eat and he orders a hamburger they usually taste sweet which he finds awkward . He says the burger and fries here are good and they are cheap too!

XWu7UsMCw-FIlNJancu5RA.text: Great hole in the wall restaurant. A good mix of food and people. Don't be scared off by the location. This spot is very Ohana. The owner came out and greeted our table serval times. We felt the aloha spirit for sure brah. Ono grinds, come check it out bruddah.

yBB9HHVdq3gooLpBL_1DzQ.text: This is my second time trying this restaurant after reading all the yelp reviews. I felt it didn't live up to the hype. The food is only so so and not something I would go back for. The Kahlua pork with cabbage was greasy and salty with too much fat. And the shrimp in the spicy noodle tasted like dirt. And the decor is so old fashioned and run down looking. Like a restaurant stuck in the 80s. Service was ok. But don't go near closing cuz they might turn you away so they could close. Overall I felt the restaurant was overrated.

IyoO5DyFRfG_4AfW2l9lxA.text: We arrived a little late... 8:40pm.. They close at 9pm BUT they were so fine about that! The place was half full which is great for them! They were very nice and FAST! We got boiled peanuts along with a variety of other appetizers (not sure what to call it) complimentary! Our food came out in less then 10 minutes and the flavors were impeccable! The staff was very attentive and helpful even with packaging our to-go's ! When we were leaving the two women at the counter (looked very busy counting money and other) stopped and smiled and thanked is for coming in and enjoying the food! I LOVE a good staff!!  This is the best hawaiian spot by far in Las Vegas.

Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bulgogi! Comes sizzling and is DELICIOUS!!

or1OiMRfjDh_YkV6ye2MXw.text: MOST EXCELLENT Korean restaurant.. probably the best one I've tried in Vegas. I've ordered a myriad of things in the 2 visits and they've all been damn good. My favorite has been their yukgaejang (spicy beef soup), which is almost on par with my mom's. Oh, their spicy pork and squid stir fry is REAAALLY good. As in my mom, who doesn't like pork, likes it, and my husband, who doesn't like squid, has no problem plucking out the pork. Their Korean-Chinese dishes are also very very good.. their jjajjangmyun is second only to Young King's version in Los Angeles. Oh, and their loco moco tasted almost as good as the version I last had on the Big Island.  As a testament to how good this place is, my folks moved out to Vegas about a month ago, and this place was the first Korean place they checked out on their own, based on the to-go order I brought back for them the day of their move. My mom likes their soon dooboo, and said their kimchi is also really good.   Pay no heed to the neighborhood nor the strip mall location of this place, as their food is on par with some of the Korean restaurants in K-town Los Angeles. Yep, that good.

AlxNjFUKd6Nx7KD5xX945Q.text: My favorite favorite Korean place in all of Vegas! So home style and delicious! Service is awesome and food is phenomenal. Must try if u've been drinking hard and need a hangover cure! Lol. It help me back to normal just now :). Great place!

Igmvtck93SYdS83lAxisBQ.text: "Attention is the rarest and purest form of generosity." - S. Weil   A wonderful spot for great tasting food on a no-frills budget.  We came to Island Style looking for Jajangmyun (Wheat noodles in a black bean sauce) and Seafood Jjamppong (Wheat noodles with spicy broth)...we found really good versions of both of these dishes as well as some other pleasantries.  The Jajangmyun was made with love. I tasted exactly how I imagine my Korean grandma would make it...if of course, I had a Korean grandmother... Needless-to-say it was great! Jajangmyun is a highly pleasing dish. The black bean provides great flavor, but also makes for a nice thick sauce--coating the noodles as well as your tongue...and who doesn't enjoy the occasional tongue coating? I enjoyed this dish more than the Seafood Jjamppong, but the Jjamppong was pleasing too with all kinds of seafood swimming in a delightfully spicy broth.  The service this night was on point--attentive of our needs and even fulfilling some of them before we realized there was a need...recommendations, drinks, utensils, side dishes, condiments, to-go boxes...everything taken care of. The banchan (side dishes) were a little more hit and miss then I am used to, but these rotate, and the overall experience more than made up for this area.  This certainly not a place that would draw me in on its own. The facade is simple and cheap looking. The interior is modest as well. But the food is priced according to the humble appearance of the restaurant, not the quality of food. As such, it is a welcome spot in my rotation.

xxnJF2c0QHTutxOZpHX6Qw.text: Love this place. I always make this a mandatory stop when visiting vegas. Always get the mix plate! Love there kimchee also.

S6sEhiIH1W4zJPdXTyY4yA.text: Best Hawaiian food in Las Vegas. Into a lot of places and these guys are the best. Friendly service and the owners are excellent people.

kfXc-FPAiPY8_0O9aPGRUg.text: Came to this place on whim, craving Hawaiian food but not the typical fast food type that is arpund where I live. I've driven past this place a few times going to Diamond China and Herbs & Rye... and the Yelp reviews were a end deciding factor. Seemed to be a small family owned style restaurant that has regular customers as many were greeted/chatted with for a bit. We came at opening 11am last weekend and it got fairly busy with the first half hour, with half the tables being filled.   I would definitely say this place caters to more Korean style food than Hawaiian, but I'm not complaining! Boiled peanuts come standard as an appetizer while waiting for your food. We both ordered the combo which included kalbi short rib, meat chun, bbq chicken, rice and mac salad. Everything on the plate was absolutely delicious and full of flavor. We also got a great variety of banchan that included kim chee, pickled cucumbers, seaweed, bean sprouts, and what looked to be some kind of pickled citrus. All were very tasty.   Soda comes in cans here, but at least only $1.50. They also carry Hawaiian Sun cans as well. The only spots were they lost me were the kind of slow service and the price. The price is quite hefty than what I'm used to, with each combo plate being $17. As for quality and taste, superb. I'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo plates and banchan

iD02hso9FyIhxiTMIXqCkA.text: Every time I come here I always try to order something different from the last time. So far, I've had their pan fried mandu, spicy beef noodle soup, jap chae, sweet and sour pork, saimin, hot stone bimbimbap, and meat jun..they're all very good:)

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HMBO5RgEH_vttCeVuBDv1g.text: Island Style was one of the first Hawaiian/local places I tried when I first moved to Vegas. It's still as good as I remember it all those years ago (ok, not THAT long ago..) and is still one of the best meat jun places I have found here in Vegas.   Being from Hawaii, I LOVEEEEE my meat jun and have been searching for something that hits close to home. Nothing has even come close here in Vegas, but Island Style still does it right. Very large portions and good side dishes will keep me coming back for more.   They have a very extensive menu of traditional Korean items as well as local favorites like loco mocos yummmmm. I have also tried their black bean noodle and it's pretty tasty as well. The service is pretty attentive as well.

fGDVsFMyeoxridwwrJHRNw.text: The island style restaurant was so Ono and service was great!!  Food was great and Unkl Russell (originally from Hilo, HI) was awesome and made us feel like we was at home!!  This is definitely the place to go when in Vegas!!  We be back...Mahalo Unko Rus!!

AL5MI3XAjrDjXWPEQqydWA.text: Came here a few weeks ago with some work friends for a goodbye lunch.  Still lots of aloha spirit at Island Style!  I was feelin' the Korean vibe that day so I went with a staple, the Bi Bim Bop.  Rice topped with bulgogi beef with lots of veggie sides like pickled carrots & daikon, bean sprouts, spinach, and cucumber, all topped off with a runny sunny side up egg, sesame seeds & seaweed!  Comes with a side of broth too for pouring over.  Delicious!  Love that runny egg yolk combining with the hot rice & bulgogi, then getting the crunch from the cool veggies.  That's some good eats!  I should have opted for a dollar or 2 more for the Bi Bim Bop in the hot stone pot, would have been sizzling hot from beginning to end.  Island Style has the hookup for banchan too!  Who else in town served boiled peanuts as banchan?  Such a good start to a meal.  I had no shortage of other banchan either - kim chee, kim chee cucumbers, bean sprouts & more.  Sides to my hearts content!  I also got a Cheeseburger as well.  Surprisingly simple & tasty!  Flat top grilled meat, cheddar cheese, fresh lettuce & tomato, bun.  And lots of mayo & ketchup just the way I like it!  Opted for no fries, needed to keep the calorie count down LOL.  Island Style I'll be back again when I need me some down home eats!  Hawaiian!  Oh....and Korean!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bi Bim Bop

6bevoJsy-HYN5OZ6AQrR1g.text: This looks like a hole in the wall.  But trust me, the food is well-prepared.  My Bimimbop was delicious.  In fact, everything was very good.  My husband loved his Bulgogi too.

LOej_Ag3wZaEO-5a1l5uVA.text: Some of the best Korean food in Vegas and if you want some Hawaiian food it's really good too!   Been coming here for years!  Hands down awesome customer service from everyone that works here!

zr-Ps8tEaAhT65-FmUnE7w.text: This spot was so good. Amazing food and service. I had the meat jun and having grown up in Hawaii this place was up to par.

0-_xjSTEb8RmIbd6DZEzow.text: I always stop here whenever I'm in Vegas. Food is good but pricey. I luv the side dishes that comes with our meals.

NXqKeYHCJQgxg_x2DQajuw.text: I think this is our umpteenth time here.  We came here when it was only the one section and then they expanded and now the owner (Russell) has two places - this place and one in the K-town market which we haven't been to yet.  The food here is always repeatably good and a place we crave when we come to hang out in LV.  As for the food, I love the cold noodles (obviously) when hot in LV, and then in the winter/colder visits, it's chap-chei or loco moco!  Sorry for not posting photos nut as usual we start chowing down after saying grace...I have to have an intermediary step after being thankful with taking photos.  We love their mandu deep fried!

RTDrcbI0ZfbZxmo3umS0wQ.text: We love the food, the casual vibe and the people who work there.   We recently brought a large group of friends there for the first time, and now they too are regulars.  The food is of course the main reason we keep coming back.  The Korean menu is first-rate, they give you nice size portions and it is always delicious.  The people are friendly and they are eager and accommodating in helping us try something new each time we go.  If your looking for Korean-Asian food this is the place to go.

jykQ7QOUIOh3LuabDRc9KQ.text: Food was great. Service was great. Kids really loved the pan fried mandu. Kalbi was good. Kinda pricey, but it always is.

TX9H_pNQtpqdisXK4mv-4A.text: Our first time visiting today. We ordered the hot stone bibimbop and it was amazing! Service was really good. The lady even helped us and gave us tips on how to eat the bibimbop! Will definitely come back on our next visit!

f8BMUhfm-eyCUQiOaXLJiw.text: don't let the retail plaza exterior scare you away.  So friendly and kind they even help mix food for my senior guests.  We ordered mostly hot stone pots and a spam musubi.  Portions are ridiculously large so be ready for a take out box or share entrees.  The kimchi was popular.  The sprouts were light on the sesame oil but still  tasty. The namul in our hot pots were fresh and crisp. BBQ sauce also pleasant.  Interior very basic but at 5:00 this place fills up ....appears to be an early arriving crowd that lightens up by 6:30-7:00.  Kitchen is fast.

c7sCArMSSEP7AJUE1fy20Q.text: Everything tastes just like back home in Hawaii. Great service. A lot of Hawaii people to meet and visit. Going back for sure.

3XX9Yw0GJjCk3cfD8C1g1g.text: Mmmm...When I have my cravings,  I like coming here.  The food and service are great!  Russell is like the guy you would know back home from Hawaii.   He's really friendly and treat you like family.  I've had their Kalbi, kalbi soup, oxtail soup, meat jun... I can go on and on.  I'm drooling just thinking about all that yummy food.

ziMpvYBpMzKd6fN6VNdUcQ.text: Absolutely my favorite Taste of Hawaii !! A mix of the Hawaian Island's favorites cooked perfectly. Never a disappointment, and the boiled peanuts take this place over the top.  Thank you for keeping the traditional flavors alive in Vegas.

_O-hugq_brGxYxBzZnqAqA.text: Love love island style. We've been here too many times to count. I love their stone pot bibimbap and that they make it all veggie for me. I can drink/eat all the barley iced tea and the appetizer dishes. My bf loves the cold noodles and my daughter usually gets one of the meat plates. My only complaint is that I wish they were open on Sunday's like today we had plans on going and keep forgetting it's the one day that they aren't open.

DpCdQp76mtn4PpiuovjG2Q.text: Lunch here about 1:45 on a Friday. It's in a small strip mall and the parking was impossible - barely got a place.   This place came recommended by a friend and it's authentic Korean. The menu is in Korean translated into English and like all really authentic places there are a few additional items offered only in Korean.   We all ordered soups. My mandu soup was delicious. My son's seafood soup was also delicious but some of the clams did not open up so they could not be eaten. Wife's soup good also. The service was friendly but food delivery not ideal. My soup was delivered first, and a few minutes later my son's. I was half finished with my meal when my wife's food was finally delivered.   If you can find a place to park, I'd recommend giving their food a try.

PcYMAMqTD_PMHPZcMsg1ng.text: This place is the bomb! Had the Kim Chee , spicy cucumber awesome! I had the stone pot OM! Oysters soooo fresh and Ono!!! We are everything!!!

0GzceH8VE7E3k7Wd91VFtw.text: Island Style is a Korean establishment masquerading as a Hawaiian restaurant masquerading as a Korean restaurant. This type of fusion fare certainly is a unique one as most Hawaiian food has a heavy Japanese influence. In the end, comfort food is amazing when prepared by people who know it best. The inviting servers here sit you down as if you had just stepped into their home. Our waitress was reminiscent of my Korean friend's mom who would feed us her home-cooked meals.   The menu is filled with some Hawaiian favorites such as spam musubi and loco moco, among others, but the other half offers Korean dishes such as mandu (Korean dumplings) and meat jun (egg-battered meat; also with a fish option). As with any Korean restaurant, the table is offered banchan and rice water tea. I was pleasantly surprised by how good the meat jun was, especially with the flavorful and tender thinly-sliced beef. If you're seeking a noodle dish, the black bean noodles were some of the best I've ever had. The eclectic food was fantastic and I can't wait to return to try the rest of the items on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat jun
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mandu

XFsgAHXzjCtdk6nMj-TcmA.text: Saw this place yelp. Originally thought it was mostly Hawaiian but I guess I read it wrong and it was mostly Korean.   The kalbi was great. Although it's pretty hard to get kalbi wrong. And from a Korean establishment I wouldn't expect anything less than great.   I also had the tofu soup. Big portion. Very good. Definitely one of the better ones I've had! Could've fed 2 people.   The ox tail soup was okay. Nothing special.   The spam musubi. Not great not bad. Just plain regular.   The fried saimin. You don't have many places that serve this so it was very refreshing to see it. So we had to try it. Very large family style portion.  Toppings were tasty. Noodles were kind of bland. Almost chow mein like. They gave it a nice try. But it's not reminiscent of the islands if you know what I mean.   I'd give this place a 3 but they were very nice and service was fast.   I'm always a little skeptical when Asian restaurants have more than one type on their menu (I.e. Korean, Hawaiian, Japanese) but hey that's Hawaiian food in a nutshell so we gave it a shot. Not a place I'd put on my list to come back to since were from out of town, but it was definitely worth a try. If you love Korean food and Hawaiian food then this place is worth a shot. Bummed we didn't get to try the meat jun because that is also very rare to find.

LWpq7LRTYaDFI3ZvR7wX6Q.text: Love!!! Great food. Cute little resturant.  Full of locals... can't beat that.  Everything was great! We will be back soon!

x-SbXuHIlq3_ucAzwfse_w.text: I love this place! The food is delicious and service is spot on!I believe its family run, so you feel welcome each and every time! The first thing I have to say is, the service blew me away! Great service made me feel as if I was eating supper at my grandmothers. Of course I had to order what everyone else on yelp had been raving about. I ordered the notorious combo plate. You get what ya pay for! Huge portion and it was delicious! Finally to top it off I received and otter pop at the end of my meal. Will definitely return when I'm around this side of town and in the mood for some Korean/Hawaiian fusion!

_bjaLTLDfx-xYr2KO-Ixcg.text: First time here with the gf, she had been begging to show me the place after coming here with her girlfriends during their nights out. Totally worth the trip! 2NNb5E4eB77S-VoeslGdBw.text: Went here because I was in the mood for jjampong and jjajangmyun. Most places don't have the combo (jjamjjamong) where they give you half of both or don't allow it to-go. I was pleasantly surprised to see this place offered it and for to-go orders as well. The noodles were tasty and cooked perfectly and the sauce and soup were also both great. The soup especially had lots of seafood inside - crab, shrimp, clams, and octopus - which was amazing for the price. Definitely would recommend and can't wait to try more things next time.

lP96-93k2IzNovQBYZdUsg.text: I loved everything I tried! First time here and it was awesome! You get a lot for your money! I got the fried swimming and it was great! I also tried the oxtail soup, Kalbi ribs and spicy pork paired with squid.... BRAH IT WAS MEAN! I would definitely come here again! Everything had so much flavor! It's not too spicy to not eat it was just enough heat for a good taste. They are definitely doing things right here! Oxtail soup was different tasted like chicken long rice but was still very good! Kalbi was full of taste perfectly cooked! Just enjoyed everything!

w26L5D4WA_D1LkNszDMs0g.text: Prices were on the high side, but it was so worth it. I'd definitely be back! I ordered the combo (Kalbi ribs, meat jun & bbq chicken) and was surprised by the portion and how good the rice was.  Food was very tasty including the small vegetable dishes. Service was good and everyone was friendly.  This is the best Korean I've tasted in Vegas.  This restaurant is Kamaaina approved.  Finally, satisfying Ono food that's worth your money!

0dPeqPu_0gyeUvkNjmZrdg.text: Holy mother!!!  Here is the best bulgogi, teriyaki, and spicy pork I have ever had. Potstickers... not so great but the deliciousness of the meat was far to superior to give them a 4star rating.  I was really full when we went here... and good lord did I eat a ton. I just kept eating and eating and eating and eating and.... well you get the freaking. The meat was perfectly marinated and was accompanied with some delicious onions that were soaking in the marinade.  I really wish I could fully explain the experience I had here, but suffice it to say that all you need to do is stop looking at the screen turn on your GPS and get here just to try it.  oh and ps... the random ass macaroni salad that came with the meal was really good to. Not to sweet or salty but the perfect food to cleanse your pallet to get you ready to stuff SOOOOOOOOOO much meat in your mouth.  THE VERDICT: best bulgogi I have ever had? maybe. best spicy pork I have ever had, absolutely. and if you are able to make me even question is this the best ever it makes me think. maybe the best korean fusion place I have ever been to. welp... see ya later.

Qcna43oSsmOg0RN-HaX3fw.text: Very good Korean food and island flavors of teriyaki, fried rice, and your fix of Spam and eggs and Hawaiian Sun juices. Banchan sides are so tasty. Hubby and I shared the buckwheat noodles with plenty of veggies; Korean pear slivers helped cool off the spiciness for me. Coming here over the years every time we're in Vegas and happy that they expanded this location plus opened a new spot in the Greenland supermarket food court.

IilFQMIrFxanYI8O-jJwDw.text: I have been coming to this place since they started way back in 90's.  Love the chicken cutlet and meat jun.  Boiled peanuts reminds me of back home in Hawaii.  Gina and Russell are great people I wish them the best for many years to come.

95sVGER-02kmF2PZtZnTtA.text: To be perfectly honest I was underwhelmed my first try at this place. I ordered the tofu soup and it was lacking a lot of flavor. The side dishes (banchan) were all really good. My boyfriend ordered the bbq combo plate that comes with bbq chicken and meat jun he loves this place so I gave it a try. Next time I'll stick to the local plate lunches instead of the korean food. The fried mandoo was bomb, I'd definitely come back for those! The service was great and you can tell they have a really loyal customer base, everyone that walked in said hi to the staff and was greeted like family. All in all this place wasn't terrible just wasn't my favorite.

kA-JgvOdYL5V2ONGGZQtwg.text: Island Style...kept popping up when I search "restaurants nearby" and we finally tried it out. I think this is my new favorite place! tried the bibimbap in a hot stone bowl, served sizzling hot to make the rice crispy and cook your egg through. Banchan was on point with kimchi, white seaweed salad, pickled seaweed, bean sprouts, cucumber kimchi and boiled peanuts. we also tried the kimchi stew served with some kinda fried fish, and the chicken curry. so good. will definitely return! we ordered too much food and they boxed it all up and even added some banchan extras - worth it! will return!

36C_zZ-ueUwgPb7pOdXwMQ.text: 2 words: Meat Jun.  I just discovered meat jun on a recent trip to Hawaii with my boyfriend.  I'm so happy that he introduced me to this simple yet super tasty dish that I have just fallen completely in love with.  Thank you Jeremy C.!  Every since I had it at 3 different restaurants in Oahu, I had to find one in Vegas.  Verdict: Island Style does not disappoint.  It is almost as close to the meat jun served at Millions in Oahu.  Flavorful well season beef inside a hefty egg batter served over white rice or fried rice!  Don't forget to dip it in their tasty sauce for an amazing trip in your mouth!  Their dumplings here are a great appetizer too!  And the workers here; I believe a family that used to live in Oahu, are super nice and friendly.  We chopped it up with them about the Islands and food!  My boyfriend and I will definitely be back for the meat jun and to try their other menu items!  They're straight from Hawaii so I'm sure the rest of the food here is legit!  Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sides!

B4CmShIXiCCIRYM9cyt2SA.text: This place has great food and AMAZING service. I had dinner here for the first time yesterday. I flew in from Denver looking for good Hawaiian comfort food. This place had lots of options but I ended up getting the teriyaki salmon. I was expecting to just get a plate lunch, but I was pleasantly surprised that this was a sit down restaurant. I was greeted by Russell who brought out six mini dishes of kimchi and things. He brought out napa cabbage kimchi, cucumber kimchi, bean sprout, daikon, some kind of crunchy mayo seaweed thing, and boiled peanuts. I've eaten at Korean restaurants before but I usually I expect to pay at least $25 in Denver to get all of the kimchi sides with my meal. The prices here range from about $2.75 for a musubi to $16 for the generous serving of teriyaki salmon, and a bit more for the kalbi. Typically, I have to keep asking for refills for the kimchi at other places but Russell was really quick to fill up the mini dishes without prompting. When he came by the first time, I had a few pieces of cucumber left and he came by and took the (not quite) empty dish. I thought he was getting ready to clear the table but he was just filling everything up before I ate the last bits. If this isn't amazing customer service, I don't know what is. When the teriyaki salmon plate came, there were two good sized pieces of salmon, a light teriyaki sauce on the side, a bed of rice, and mac salad. The salmon was cooked perfectly and the sauce was a very light consistency - with a sweet (but not over powering) flavor. I was skeptical about the sauce because I'm used to eating a more viscous teriyaki sauce. So I dipped a small piece of salmon in it initially just to try it. Then I ended up dumping the sauce on the salmon and rice, it was that good. My toddler was sleeping in her stroller but she woke up literally right when I finished the last bite of my meal. Russel asked if he could bring her a small plate of rice and hot dog. I said yes. I didn't know that he meant a COMPLIMENTARY plate of rice and hot dog. After our meal, he served me barley tea. That was good too. I also ordered spam musubi and chicken musubi to go. I felt the True aloha spirit at this restaurant and will make this my "go to grindz" place whenever I come to Las Vegas! I attached pictures of my meal, the kimchi sides, and the menu, check 'em out!

UjPaEx7afFzycdBLSwCmfg.text: Island Style serves up affordable, delicious bibimbap and banchan with attentive and sweet service. This pocket gem can be hard to find and I was finally notified of its existence when my co-workers suggested it for lunch.  My favorite parts of a Korean meal are the complimentary banchan plates and hot tea and this place delivered. The standard kimchi, sprouts, and pickled cucumbers tasted sour and "fresh". Surprises included tasty diced franks sauteed with onions; boiled peanuts; steamed broccoli; and salty, dried tiny fish. But don't expect all of this in one meal. Every visit yielded different banchan plates and that's totally fine in my book.   The signature bibimbap was executed very well. It's served hot and the medley of diced vegetables, sliced steak, steamed rice, and a fried egg came out perfectly like Kim Yuna landing a triple lutz. The serving size is ridiculously generous and I NEVER finished.  It's served two ways: regular bowl ($8.95) and hot spot ($9.95). I personally liked the regular bowl better because the hot pot can turn the rice super crispy and that those little suckers will get stuck in your molars. But the hot pot is fanciful and the sizzling caused me to oohh and ahhh. Definitely, a dish if you desperately want attention from others.

gVfgxveruoCO-fegvvXAPQ.text: If you have a car while you're in town, definitely check this place out!  We ordered the meat combination plate, it comes with kalbi, teriyaki chicken, mean jun (meat omelette), macaroni salad and rice, wonton saimin and spam masubi...   The combination plate is great if you want a little of everything! All the flavors were right on and the meat jun was cooked perfectly! The spam masubi was a little dry, it needed a little more teriyaki sauce or something, so I wouldn't waste stomach space on this.   While we were there, it seemed as though EVERYONE ordered the jajangmyun (Korean wheat noodles in a black bean sauce... i will definitely be back to try that out!!

OlvdAuOY2bePZAhKsZ1kpA.text: I go here for the awesome banchan, great and quick service, and the fact that I don't ever go over $10 on my lunch. I usually order the shrimp fried rice and share that with a friend. The food is hot and delicious and the style is very casual. The soup that comes with the meal is always palatable and appetizing. Even the tea they serve hot is wonderful. I go to this joint maybe 2-3 times a month by myself to enjoy the food, if that tells you anything!!

JatG78sB5rfKwociXCu92A.text: I've eaten here at least 5 times in the last 3 months. The service is friendly and welcoming, food is DELICIOUS, and the portions are perfect for the price you pay. Whenever I'm in the area, this is always my first place I choose to eat if I get hungry.. and my fiance agrees!

_KzZs1OB8W7TT9niyglvHw.text: I was having a jyajyanmyun craving and this place's jyajyanmyun was on point. The hosts were really nice and kept on providing refills of kimchi.   Their chicken musubi was also decent.

WVCHfm_Q08Wjt9sb9EVWGA.text: "MAH SHI SUH!"     "ONO!"  I just haadd to say "delicious" in both Korean and Hawaiian.   Island Style is quite the hole-in-the-wall. Now I am aware they have added a new location in the Greenland Supermarket food court, but I urge you to try it's original location first. It's a little mom and pop restaurant located in the middle of an older business complex. It seems very modest from the outside, as the small establishment is covered by highly reflective film on its storefront. Nonetheless, from the moment you walk in, there's a overwhelming feeling of coziness. It is furnished nicely with wood flooring and homely decorations, which provide a nice and warm environment to eat in. It reminds me of being in someones own kitchen, especially since the owners are extremely genuine and welcoming.   On to the goodies. I've been here several times, and it's often a struggle to decide whether to choose something from the Korean menu or the Hawaiian side. Both are equally solid. I have a few favorites on the Korean side, the stand-outs being the Casseroles and the Cold Buckwheat Noodle soup (Neng Myuhn), which is THE BEST IN TOWN. I live in the far Southwest side of town, and when I get a craving for Neng Myuhn, I take the 20 minute drive without hesitation. For those of you who haven't had this dish, you might be a little intrigued over a noodle-based soup that is served... well, cold. It is mainly a summer dish, but plenty still enjoy it throughout the colder seasons. The ingredients are fairly simple. The soup consists of a beef broth, is chilled, the served with thin and stringy buckwheat noodles. The garnishes are what really tie this dish together; sliced lean beef brisket, julienned cucumber, sliced Asian pears, pickled radish, and half of a hard-boiled egg adorned with sesame seed sprinkles. You are also presented with white vinegar and hot Korean mustard paste, both are things that I add to mine. The reason why Island Style's Buckwheat Noodle soup reigns supreme is because their broth is perfectly seasoned and the noodles glutinous texture is just right, or "al dente", if you will. If you haven't had this yet, and are a fan of Korean cuisine, I strongly suggest you try this, regardless of the temperature outside.  Island Style's Hawaiian fare also delivers, and it's apparent because this place is frequented by Vegas's local Hawaiians. I've tried most of their offerings, which consist of the usual favorites. My personal go-to dish tends to be the mixed plate, with the Meat Jun often being the first to disappear from my plate. I do recall them having a few specialty Hawaiian items on Thursdays, such as Kalua Pork & Cabbage and Ahi Poki which were delightful as well.   There really isn't much else to add, except.... BOILED PEANUTS?! OMNOMNOMNOM. Oh and the Fried Mandu (Pork Dumplings) are also worthy of being labeled best in town. Hand-made daily.  Anyways, Island Style never fails to provide a quality meal in warm, homely atmosphere by owners who really seem to enjoy taking care of their local, and first time customers.

LBvlJ4ujKL-ST9WtVQkAtA.text: They are always so nice whenever I come in.  Even though I always do take-out, the service and quality of their food is wonderful.  I'm always greeted with some boiled peanuts (yum!) and some water or green tea while I wait for my food.  I've been on the search for some good hamburger steak/loco moco and I do have to say, it is one of the best that I've tasted here in Vegas.  The gravy tastes homemade, not from powder like most. And the hamburger is yummy, but a bit overdone.  I need to remember to ask for it to be cooked medium.  Even with my drive home clear across town, the egg is always perfectly over easy.  Also, the have some super delicious fried noodles.  That is also a hard thing to find out here.  Whatever we order, we ALWAYS have to have an order of fried noodles to go with our food.  Most places seem to use a lesser quality noodles when making this, but yours is perfect!!  We're still making our way through the menu, but so far, everything has been great!

MlDy7c2Nic1YrSYUAfOx4g.text: Soooo I wanted Hawaiian poke and figured since this place was "Hawaiian" they would have some. To my disappointment they didn't. But wait! As soon as I got there they served us water and boiled peanuts (sound weird but they are good). They also served Korean appetizers such as kimchi, seaweed salad,and bean sprouts. My bf and I ordered cold noodles and bulgogi. Not only was the food good, but service was excellent! I am not a local but felt very welcome by everyone that worked there. Try this place you won't be disappointed!

3B_6JVjw3P_iu3oRysl_AQ.text: This place is legit!  Delicious food, great service, the owners are very friendly and even poured me some hot tea when I finished.  Katsu chicken is very crispy and flavorful. The sauce is definitely home made and delicious.  Will be back to try the Korean menu next time!

NpP73UboxvKCgg2wXg8-Kw.text: their food is always AWESOME!!! where i work and peeps from Hawaii or even peeps that visited the islands who crave for local food i always suggest here as number one on my list then some other places for local foods.

d7rWWcdFF2dwVE46Jb5CfQ.text: Las Vegas is blessed with many terrific Hawaiian restaurants, but only one spectacular one:  Island Style.  While Island Style's menu certainly  holds its own against its competition, its True advantage lies in its affable, long-time owner, Russell.  His enthusiasm for his offerings is as unprecedented as it is well-deserved.  My family and I have enjoyed nearly every item on his menu, and we have yet to be disappointed.  During our most recent visit, Russell even went so far as to invite us to call him if we ever would like to try to cook one of his specialties at our home in Houston.  Not a chance!  We shall continue to let the master do his work in the kitchen while we sip hot tea and eat boiled peanuts in his dining room.  Do not be fooled by the storefront and off-strip location.  Island Style is the best bet that you will ever make in Las Vegas.

roGRHxCQ_5jG2Qq7Li3mzw.text: just felt like eating some hawaiian food today and decided to try this based on yelp reviews...it's a hole in the wall but the service was AMAZING! the super nice owner came to our table a few times to make recommendations...went with the meat jun and i freaking LOVE it! it's obvious that the owner loves what he does, very happy guy and proud of his restaurant. food was superb, generous, and not overpriced. i will definitely go back again.

k7u3-ZOTbKVQixwVaIfllA.text: This is where I get my Korean Hawaiian plate fix.  Love the veggies that come with the meal, so Ono and the soup.  Saimin is awesome too.

jWfRqAbHGfY7jIOOod-mjg.text: The food is consistently very yummy.  love all their selection.  I like how they mix Hawaiian and Korean food together...fusion

5-wwcsgYBn4NnyNcA4PRrQ.text: Overall This place is GREAT! The restaurant itself isn't very big seating for about 30. The food came out in a timely manner and the owner was very friendly. Read on for what to expect from a visit! Once entering the owner greeted and seated us. He then asked if we had ever eaten there before or a place like it. After giving us some menus he went and got us some boiled peanuts and waters. He explained the menu and gave us recommendations based off what we said we liked. Before our food came out he brought us some cabbage and daikon radish in a slightly spicy sauce which was very tasty along with some bean sprouts. Our food came out very fast and was exactly was amazing. The owner explained how the food was to be eaten and what sauces were best on what foods. After all was said and done 2 people ate two very filling meals for $20 and will return again!

uyPPtfZS5zpYNLzAleYTeg.text: Very friendly service and comfortable clean environment. Had fried dumplings (very crispy and delicious) and the won ton soup ( huge portion and full of taste). Recommend.

p9Ph0tFA8n8wTwlHvUI9dw.text: We had our last dinner here at Island Style on our mini vacation to Vegas. I am still craving that MEAT JUN and I was there two weeks ago. I have no idea what they put in the egg batter, but it it addicting. I will travel far and wide just to have meat jun again. I ordered the combo. Everything was delicious, but the meat jun is what stood out to me. I have never had anything like it before. My mouth is watering just thinking of it.  To wash off my delicious meal. I had the Hawaiian Sun Mango Orange. That too was addicting. I had two cans in one sitting. I am normally just a water drinker. The owner was also very friendly. I loved how he called everyone "Brotha" and "Sista". It made me feel part of his ohana. Island Style makes me wish I was a local. Then I can fulfill my meat jun craving whenever I have it, which it now.

l5gl5wKrZwI1qjyeyLmfRg.text: great korean hawaiian food. theres more emphasis on the korean dishes. i usually get their mixed plate.the owner is always chill and reminds me of a lot of my hawaiian college friends.i cant stop eating their salted boiled peanuts. if i had their salted boiled nuts at a bar i think life i would be grand.

kerVW2renozpRsQZnekkPg.text: Complete hole in the wall place that if you don't know about it you will drive right by it without stopping.  If it hadn't been for Yelp I would never have found out about this place, and that thought makes me sad.  The owner Russel runs the small dining room, and his wife is the cook in the kitchen.  He's a really upbeat guy who greets you when you walk in the door and is really helpful with deciding what to have.  He asked me if I was hungry and he immediately told me to get the combo when I said yes.  Boy was he right, it was delicious, and the perfect amount of food, and for $9.50 I feel it was a great deal.  I would recommend listening to what he tells you you should order, and I really like that he explains what everything is if you've never had it before.  Overall, a great experience and I will undoubtedly be going back there many times.

K5CDRRopiRovoLlobMzq-g.text: Da owner Russell is da bomb! He reminds me of my unko's back home! Food is always good n plenty n there's always extra goodies thrown in, very affordable n always a good time! If u from da islands u gotta stop by bcuz it will feel like home :)

WBCcSP6tmeTDuYiCwt15MA.text: If I could give this spot 100 stars, I would. I just moved to Vegas from Seattle and have been desperately seeking a new Hawaiian spot. This place is second to none. The flavors are amazing, the quality is superb, and the environment is SO warm and inviting. I'm a bit of a snob and was nervous looking from the outside in, but when I walked in I was pleasantly surprised to find a clean, nicely decorated restaurant. This place is AMAZING and if you try it you will be a happy as I am. The chicken katsu and kalbi beef short ribs are the best items on their menu.

ry2pot55kbzkvQUEeLOWiw.text: 3 1/2 is probably more fair. For yelp 3 stars is pretty harsh, but in reality that's about fair for the rating. Food was fine, but nothing that incredible. Very friendly and polite which is hard to find. Nothing was great. Everything was very good. I'll be back to try some other things and see if it's just what I ordered that was so so. Maybe need to find other things. Prices are very inexpensive.

71wbzgWeppqvhjnwXRMEuQ.text: Great Korean food, friendly personal service.  Don't be put off by the strip-mall placement, and mirrored windows.  So glad we decided to eat here.

WDCQnGRNS7dfYU0mCCufHw.text: Great Kalbi ribs.  The best Kalbi I've ever had was near Diamond Head crater in Honolulu.  These ribs were the second best.  Amazing portions, great service in a small hidden location.

bO4EQzyxsLcVIyGjPUshaw.text: Paid my first visit to Island Style today, and will DEFINITELY return! So good! I really needed some korean food, and this really did it.   Split a combo with the bbq chicken, meat jun, and kalbi, some fried saimin with spam(best way to get it), and the hot rock (dolsot) bibimbap between two people (a steal for around 30 bucks.. PLUS LEFTOVERS!)  The chicken and kalbi were delicious, and you really didn't even need the dipping sauce that came with them. Moist, savory, and slightly sweet. It was the first time I had ever tried meat jun, and it was great. I happen to love eggs though.   The bibimbap (you have to get the one in the hot rock/dolsot style, because you mix it together and press down to get the rice crispy!) was great. Definitely ask for that spicy/sweet paste to add a couple dollops before you mix it in. Really legit bibimbap.   Fried saimin was also good. Great balance of flavors and it was slightly salty and mild. Spam is the real way to get it, you get to experience the saltiness of the spam flavor with the slight sweetness of the cabbage and kamaboko (fish paste cut into strips, the pink and white stuff), and richness of the egg. They gave us a TON of this stuff.  They also served us boiled peanuts (which were delicious), some kimchi and kimchi style raddish, and some nice palate cleansing broth.   I wish I could have eaten everything. I'm definitely getting the curry or loco moco to go next time.

F8Ma5kCJ_COJzuVeFR7N0g.text: I've been here when it was just a quarter of the size it is now. Russell was always so great with his customers! They even incorporated a Chinese addition to their menu. The menu is Korean Hawaiian fusion.The restaurant is much larger now but the food seems the same which is the most important. I love their meat jun, it's a meat cake fried in egg batter and it's paired with macaroni salad, rice, and of course your traditional korean appetizers. It's a joint perfect for asian cravings.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat Jun madness

wud2WdT6D8Ja5eH8SPwYZA.text: Comin from SF, This place is bomb. Honestly the food is great and the service is amazing. "Uncle" is such a nice dude and treated my family right! Mahalo!

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #amazing

5Sz03MFTvxs0p6ThJAxRiA.text: Last couple times I went to Island Style I had Bulgogi and rice and a side of Yaki-Mondu.  The "Yaki" stands for deep fried...  I'm a really picky eater and the food there is always great. The service is also top drawer.  Don

oLpWY9pt-RH8rNmX3Kn-CA.text: Wow! Mom and pops Hawaiian fusion Korean is the type of style food this is:: I had my soondobu:: or spicy tofu Soup:: it was SUPER spicy ( which I love) and I enjoyed it:: sizes are big here which is like Hawaii style to me:: they even give Korean side dishes!  So they have a really shady location but the service and good food make up for it:: I enjoy hole in the wall joints:: this makes that list:: will be back to try more goodies!!  They are super Keiki Friendly!! Most hospitable service I've ever had! Super mom and pops!  Thank You! \000/ :: Shaka mahalo!

oL3qwmlEVYBlJC2FMIUXdg.text: As authentic as you can get of Korean Chinese cuisine in the States! I missed home and wanted to have some asian food; very glad I came here with my colleagues. The staff here are really friendly and nice too! The free ice pop at the end of our meal was a great plus! It's how Korean cuisine are usually like - they call it "service", and it really reminds me of home. The Kimchi here is very nice too!

iSfO7Tpf2A9ITuwkJyLjtA.text: I've always heard great things & it did not disappoint! :) The prices are insanely reasonable for the amount of food you get. Banchans differ everyday & they're quite generous. The combo is the mister's go-to meal. For around $12, you get so much food for the combo. I opted for the Hot Rock Bibimbap. OHMYGOODNESS! Love at first bite. And it was around $10. We also ordered Mandu because we couldn't resist. A lady was making them a few tables away so I definitely wanted to try home-made Mandu.  All in all, this is such a great spot to eat. Definitely felt like we were back home in Oahu. With its name, Island Style, you'll most definitely notice the warm, Aloha spirit from the workers and the delicious food they serve. ONO!

uWhDw9xGRIr2ONv6ZPyN_g.text: So gald we decided to stop and eat here thanks to the reviews on Yelp!! So much fun the  owner was so friendly and inviting. Once you sit down they start bringing you a lot of different things to try all of which were great! We ordered the pan fried dumplings and they were so good we ordered some more. Our dinners were also great the hot stone bim bon bop and the variety dinner were both amazing! Eat here you wont be disappointed!

2BJKIcZzjJBpX4m5n4qj3A.text: I love this family friendly restaurant.  Everything comes out super fast.  Russell is always really friendly it reminds me of being welcomed on the warm sand of Hawaii.  I love the spin that they put on the food to make it their own.    I usually get the combo or Kalbi it is so delicious food I just want to keep eating. Also the spam and eggs are cooked to perfection.

ur_XGoK-o6xSm8KFmoJu6Q.text: For some people, it may be hard to look past the fact that the curb appeal of this restaurant is a bit on the iffy side. The parking also is not something I'm particularly fond of.  HOWEVER... their food is pretty good. I have not really had anything at Island Style that I didn't like. I especially like their deep fried dumplings.   They have a hodge podge of Korean, Chinese, and Hawaiian food. It's a good place to take someone that can't make up their minds. Ha. XD  Their portions are pretty good and it's pretty nice for a larger group, for food portions and price.

5vLdMsC5oSqOrV2yvq5MNA.text: My husband and I stopped by for a quick bite.  He had the loco moco which he liked and I decided to try a korean dish mandoo guk (dumpling soup).  My soup was just okay.  While waiting for our food, Russell the server there brought us over some boiled peanuts which was really good.  Since we were korean he offered us an older fermented type of kimchi.  Service was really great and Russell was very attentive to our needs. I give it 4 stars only because my soup was not very authentic.  I would probably return again for some other korean dishes.  UPDATE: 7/27/12 my coworker brought  me mul naeng myun (buckwheat noodle) which is served chilled.  It was actually very good and I was very impressed.  I would probably go back again when I'm in the mood some other korean dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buckwheat noodle chilled

gP4KVXTEO4c04TPO149zzw.text: This is the perfect place if you want generous portions and great food at a reasonable price!! It's a little off the strip, but I think it's definitely worth trying. It's located in a small sketchy looking plaza, and may get crowded at times.  I ordered the bulgogi plate whereas my friends got the meat jun combo. Our meals came with a small assortment of fresh banchan. I really liked the kimchi, seaweed salad, and boiled nuts. Before our entrees came out, I was already full from stuffing myself with the banchan.   The bulgogi was very delicious! I enjoyed every little bit of it - even the leftovers. The meat jun was pretty good as well. And all for around $10. What a steal! My only gripe is that they mixed up my order, which led to a bit of a delay with my entree. But luckily the banchan was there to satisfy me in the meantime. Also their cups have a strange yellow tint we just could not figure out.

l5HjSze_I-tZQ_gFIuD_zA.text: Five stars for the Kanak Attack, at the table.  Literally almost knocked out from ALL the food he gave us. My husband ordered the hamburger steak, the gentleman who worked there came to check on us and told him he needed more rice, lol!   I ordered Meat jun, barbecue chicken and kalbi with a load of rice. Buggah was ono!  The local man that obviously owns the place was so nice and welcoming, he made us feel like we were right back in Hawaii. I'd go back again BUT next time I need to be rolled out :)

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo &amp; Hamburger Steak. Plus all the extras!

37v6-SDlVQIQWV2gK7_nLg.text: This place is amazing, if you are looking for some of the best food in Vegas you have to come here. They def put their foot in the food.

0AdlFS0G8B4ChX84MVqbyA.text: Great place for Hawaiian Korean fusion. Seems like a little mom and pop shop. Food is always on point and the service is great. "Uncle" one of the waiters or owner not sure who he is lol always gives the kids popsicles or chocolate bars free of charge for dessert. They treat us like family. Highly recommend this place!

wWVoudVDtqnNhH_A4NRcgA.text: Awesome Korean/Hawaiian comfort food selection in this casual joint. I came with a group of 9 and we were able to sit down at one of many large tables. The staff was incredibly friendly and happy. We ordered pretty much everything, but my favorite had to be the combo with kalbi, meat jun, and bbq chicken. Enjoy!

ss8HsXeBHgzzUGmCTijWNA.text: This place is not even that good the food doesnt have good taste and i even told the guy that if it wasnt good i was gonna complain about it, we got home and opened the chicken katsu and it was soooo thin you could just see the crunchiness and not the meat at all, we also ordered some bbq beef and it was disgusting. I called back right away after i took a small bite on the food and i talked to the guy who took our order and nicely told him the food wasnt good and the chicken was so thin with no meat on it so i asked for my money back ( $19 for something that wasnt good i get paid that much at work but thats an hour of my ass working for throwing it away just like that ) and he told me : I TOLD YOU TO ORDER THE COMBO ONE AND YOU DIDNT LISTEN TO ME SO ITS YOUR FAULT NOT MINE & all i said is : im not gonna get something you want me to get so i got What I Always Get EVERYWHERE I Go To Eat This Type Of Food so let me talk to the manager please and he said I am the manager actually i am the owner actually and its your fault not ours so at the end he just said to bring the food back which i did and when i walked in a lady was next to him and he said : She's actually the boss and i was like wtf? Thats not what you told me over the phone liar so the lady looked at the food and gave me my money back. Bad experience ever. And i even told him over the phone , i rather get my money back and give you back the food than just making a bad review on internet , i wasnt gonna do the review but i am because he was rude and a liar.

Kjrvvq804UL2dNir9PbW9w.text: The best Korean restaurant in town.  Located on Sahara Ave, they offer pretty good deal for the price. As my husband says, "In vegas you can get what you paid for!"  Yes, that's right!  I ordered Soon dub with seafood. Ono!  Spiciness is just right for me.  My husband ordered Combo, which comes with Kalbi, Chicken and Meat Jun. This is his favorite plate.  He used to come here with his dad when he was alive and my husband was living in Vegas.   They recently renovated this place and according to my husband, the place is double the size of before.  And the price is reasonable.  I def recommend this place.

10iYP4YMHHSkwAzRVQoGBA.text: The spicy pork and squid was delicious!  When ordering soup, beware... THE BOWL IS BIG! The soup was delicious, though. I just couldn't finish the whole bowl

xWQKV67xq0di1jBIigG4eA.text: "broke da mouth" - otherwise known as "superb".   I have a unique food allergy, and telling Russell about having a white and yellow onion allergy in a local/korean place was a laugh.  But, we came through with Spam dolsot ba-bim-bop!  I ate three servings of dang-chae (appetizers: kim chee, seaweed, pickled radish, pickled bean sprouts, marinated potato, kim chee cucumber, and boiled peanute) - saving half the main dish for home!   Welcoming, fun, accommodating....delicious.  next time I'll go I'll post a photo of spam ba-bim-bop!     this place is now a favorite...

m2gzcUqiGgQXkdXVDJQRPw.text: Great value. Food is primarily Korean, but sizeable portions and good price. Very down to earth, don't expect white glove treatment since this place caters to the working class. My brother and I ordered 2 entrees, the meal could have easily fed 3 people. Tasty too.  They have long tables connected together, so I could see this place being good for groups.

l8DND0cO2YjyvDNM0bYOKQ.text: Korean food & Hawaiian food all in one! Small place but love the atmosphere! This place is 5 STAR dining for a 1 star price! They gave us apetizers to start with right away, boiled peanuts, kimchi, sausage....etc.... The food took a while to cook, but its ok coz I was busy stuffing myself with the free appetizers....I am going to warn you ahead of time though...do not gorge on the appetizers or you will be too full for the main dish! Everything on the menu looked good, I wanted to order everything! Drinks were only $1! I definitely will come back to this place just so I can try out their other dishes. And yes they have ox tail soup! Definitely a good find! I love these mom & pop establishments especially when the owners are super friendly and they really do care about their customers! Gotta try this place you won't regret it.

4iJT6IMRmXpE00DraHk6_g.text: This was my first time having Hawaiian food. I went by myself a few weeks back on a Saturday after a long day of errands. I met Russell (the owner) by the end of my meal I wanted to call him Uncle.  First I started with a nice helping of boiled peanuts then came the banchan all dishes were nice and cold. I didn't have time to finish all three before Uncle brought three more out. I eat the boiled peanuts slowly because I wanted to take the rest home, not knowing that Uncle had another batch for me to take away. I was able to have a late night snack when I got home.  I don't think that I've ever seen boiled peanuts served other than in Florida (the south). A nice addition.  I had the seafood soup. It came in a big bowl pipping hot with a big ladle and a cup of rice on the side. Uncle gave me instructions on how to put together the dish. It was a little spicy and the shrimp was a tad small but very filling. For under $10 bucks. The veg was crisp and clean. Would order it again. The broth was red so be careful slurping.  I paid my check with a very pretty girl at the desk and was on the way out when Uncle brought a plate of cold sliced watermelon. We chatted about the menu and what I can order next time. Due to the fact that I don't eat meat. He was so warm and accommodating that I'm going to look Uncle up again this weekend.  So ,of you are looking for a down home place to kick back and feel like you are at someones kitchen table. This is the place, no frills but it hits the spot.

0iTmsBnIwAHAFNJnGHsYSQ.text: Thank you Yelpers! I never would have found this gem with out you.   We showed up around 6 to a near empty restaurant playing Monday night football on a single tv. The smell was amazing from the second we got in.   We were served the complimentary boiled peanuts and glasses of water immediately. Based on reviews I decided the wonton min and the combo seemed like a good place to start. I was not let down! The complimentary kimchi was tasty and the sprout appetizer was my personal favorite.  They have a big selection of sodas for $1 and Hawaiian drinks for $1.50.  It didn't take long for the place to fill up and it seemed they did many take-out orders.   The combo was huge and each variety of meat was tastier than the last. The wonton min was large and delicious. The service was friendly and attentive and I never felt rushed.   I will return here.

nDYAez28T0mQlFZD0JusSQ.text: Fantastic food. Hole in the wall but food was amazing. I had the Korea spicy chicken and was the best chicken dish I've ever had. Can't wait to go back again.

A4OuuDjVqMLveVV169f-WA.text: Came here one time to see what all the great reviews are about. Loved the boiled peanuts we got when we first arrived & they were very kind. They have a large menu with a good variety. Prices are kind of higher than other places. We ended up ordering a meat jun plate & a loco moco .They were "okay". I found the meat jun to be on the salty side & could barely finish it. May come back to try their bibimbap.

b2Bd-zBRVck6SsHlR_B9Mw.text: I don't usually go for Hawaiian food, but my brother talked me into it when he told me about how cool the owner is and how every time he goes in he get's such a warm welcome. I love to hear stuff like that, about people who love what they do and are good at it and as a result radiate kindness and coolness.   I was not disappointed, everyone who worked there was as cool as possible. The customer service was unmatched.   As an added bonus I loved the food! Even though I would have probably kept going back even if I didn't.

9xIBX4w0GAv_FmtpBQeI-Q.text: Yelp reviews convinced my husband and I to give this place a try, and we weren't disappointed!   I had the Loco Moco, which was tasty and hearty. The gravy on its own was a bit bland but with the egg yolk and meat, it was delicious. I think I'd go with the teriyaki hamburger steak next time.  My husband had the bulgogi. The meat was sweet and flavorful and the macaroni salad was really good! He added a little sriracha and it was perfect. We also both loved the Korean side dishes, especially the kimchi.   The Solomon's Seal tea was tasty and it was something neither of us had tried before. Even with tea, bottled water, and side dishes, the meal was just $20 for the two of us! The staff was friendly and helpful, too. they made every dish sound delicious and it was a bit had to pick just a couple things to try! But both of us would be happy to go back and try something else!

teDfve5Dh8lizNz49MtuZw.text: Service was great. Food was good, ample servings. The ambiance was lacking a little though.

KQN50abeTJ4hEJtTVTweVQ.text: Wow, so delish, such great service, and - so much food comes with the hot stone, no way I could eat even half! (I think they took a page from the Italian playbook!) And only $10!! Hot, filling, healthy and super efficient and very friendly. Awesome.

P53oBY75lNnCh6n7F5zv1w.text: Really yummy food from the boiled peanuts through the pan-fried mandu to the combo plate!  Definitely a return trip location!

YaHwl6nOwOtwnEV0-vaKDA.text: This is our go-to for tasty, fast, inexpensive Korean. The kids love the bulgogi and japchae (which comes with bulgogi also), and I usually have one of the soups, either the mandoo or soon dooboo. Russell, the proprietor, is terrific. Always so friendly and welcoming. Generous portions, great value, in a simple unpretentious setting.

-97AACB4iAI9OnO4OGTIuA.text: When a Yelp reviewer described this restaurant as being a "hole in the wall", I didn't believe them until I actually saw it in person. I've been in the same shopping center plenty of times and I have never noticed this place.   What makes this place memorable and enjoyable is the customer service. Our server, he was a man, was nice, funny, and attentive. His persona is that of like a really cool uncle.  As far as the food goes, it was decent. Their kalbi and teriyaki chicken are worth getting. I disliked their spam musubi ($2/roll) because I could make better tasting ones at home. The spam & egg sandwich was drenched in so much mayonnaise that the spam slipped out when my boyfriend was trying to eat it. I also did not like the fact that their water tasted like tap water. :-\   I think I would only go here if I was nearby.

w1wn58PovJDcsZVCuPry8g.text: Island Style isn't a destination-type of restaurant like Lotus of Siam or Michael Mina. It's a neighborhood restaurant but it does a pretty good job with Korean food. I ordered the combination plate, which came with ghalbi, meat jun and grilled chicken. The ghalbi was excellent and that's what earns it a four-star rating from me. Really good grilled flavor. The meat jun is like an omelet and it was nice too. The grilled chicken was petty much standard grilled chicken. Island Style is a fusion Korean and Hawaiian restaurant and I guess that showed in my meal with the inclusion of macaroni salad with the meat and steamed rice. It was nice, too. There were only two banchan dishes, white radish kim chee and cabbage kim chee. But the dishes were quite large for banchan. The white radish kim chee was a stand out. It was a pretty good version. The kim chee at Island Style is not especially spicy but still good. If I were to go back, I'd skip the combo and just order a plate of ghalbi. But it looks like there's other good things on the menu, too.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo plate with Ghal bi, meat jun and grilled chicken, along with steamed rice and macaroni salad
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. White radish kim chee
Photo of Island Style Restaurant - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cabbage kim chee

3sCeAbquNwGXKsMojwb5Aw.text: I was so surprised with this place! The food was very good, very reasonably priced, the service was good, and everything was a good quality! Definitely a hidden gem!

AmAz4mfPiPvcRzhVYfVK8g.text: I love going to this place for their meat jun. Doesn't have a lot of fat or any for that matter. Portions are plenty! Always have to take it home. Overall, really nice people here and good food!!

C0O2xbtEb8FjnVJb_wbPhA.text: Island Style was delicious! Yummy. I really have to thank my hot waiter (Jody) because the fried rice with spam was the bomb boo. I also had the fried dumplings, the combo and teriyaki chicken on the side which were all so bomb!!!  This place has good food and great service. Love it

b4-2HCxMlvJm1mfWkB8jwQ.text: Come with an empty stomach, the portions are huge and the service is awesome.

Lmlw-nHJBw9a5VtNWerQ-g.text: This place must have changed ownership since I last went as I don't understand all the positive reviews. Went years ago frequently UNTIL....on my way back to the restroom I saw a baby in diapers on a food prep surface! I was done.......

5mJAwI3jfs6flUh7jT9unA.text: Hands down, one of the best Hawaiian restaurants I've been to. I live in LA and they have a ton of Hawaiian restaurants but this one stands out by FAR! What makes this place so great is not only the food, but the GREAT, TERRIFIC, AWESOME hospitality. The owner here just makes you feel like you're family and right at home.   The six of us ordered a bunch of different dishes and shared. Here is what we ordered:  1. Loco Moco (hamburger and egg on top of a bed of rice with gravy) 2. Fried Rice Omlet 3. Bim Bim Bop  4. Fried Saimen 5. Chicken Katsu 6. Fried Mandu (homemade, the owner was so nice to let us try this on the house)   Everything was delicious! I mean the Katsu was crunchy, the fried saimen contained the freshest ingredients (spam, cabbage, kamaboko, saimen noodles, eggs, etc), the bim bim bop had great flavor, the loco moco had some pretty awesome tasting gravy which made the dish so good, and the fried rice was great (something so simple tasting so good just tells you how good it is).  I don't know exactly what was in the fried mandu but man did that taste good as well. I don't even know what more to say except that I would highly recommend trying this place out.   Later in our trip we had Hawaiian food again at the California Club, Aloha Specialties and man, Aloha Specialties doesn't even compare to Island Style! Come here! Best meal of the trip :)

cx-YOmwBB5xzRVblUj_EpA.text: Pull into the parking lot of a most unlikely location. Approach a restaurant that looks both scary and closed. Open the door and catch a whiff of food that will make your belly happy.  Best dive in Las Vegas!  And maybe even some of the best ethnic food in Las Vegas.  I had the bulgogi. It was a generous portion of bulgogi done right and seasoned to perfection. Heaping mounds of white rice, and the even the usually dreaded Hawaiian macaroni salad was good.  But the best part? The owner made me feel like an honored guest, bringing me 4 kinds of homemade kimchi, some kind of Korean tea, boiled peanuts.   I love people who are passionate about what they do. I love people who are passionate about serving up great food. And I love people who put care and love into their food, whether it's a fancy restaurant, or a little dive in an unlikely and nearly frightening location.  5 stars to Island Style. This will become a frequent haunt.
